On October 1st, demonstrators blocked a highway with rocks and burned tires at Itojo trading centre (Ntungamo district, coordinates for Nyongozi used at prec2), following a spate of murders in the area. Police and UPDF dispersed the crowds with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

On October 3rd, police fired tear gas to disperse students at Kyambogo Univerity (Kampala), as part of an intra-student protest which centred upon an attempt to impeach the president of the student guild. The details are unclear. [size=no report]
On October 5th, a mob attacked a suspected group of kidnappers outside a bar in Kampala, beating one of the alleged criminals unconscious. [size=small]
On October 5th, taxi drivers drove from Kanungu to Kabale (Kabale district, coordinates used), in protest at the lack of security along the road. [size=no report]

column9: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Private Security Forces (Uganda)
column17: On or before October 9th, a Chinese businessman was rescued from a lynch mob in Kampala, after his bodyguard had shot and wounded a market vendor who had repeatedly protested against the businessman's parking of a truck outside of his workplace. [size=no report]

On October 11th, a plain-clothes police officer was tied up by a mob who then threatened to lynch them, after he ordered them to vacate an area of land in the area of Lwanyonyi-Kiringira (Mukono district, coordinates for Lukojjo used at prec2). The officer was saved after intervention from the land owner. The incident occurs amidst a land dispute involving eviction. [size=small]
On October 11th, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves in Mpigi town (Mpigi district). [size=small]

On October 14th, vendors blocked a road in Masaka town (Maska district) with burning logs, to demonstrate against the poor quality of the road (which diverted waste water into their stalls). Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the riots. [size=no report]

column7: Vigilante Group (Uganda); Taxi Drivers (Uganda); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
column17: On October 14th, a mob (which included a UPDF sergeant, and boda boda drivers) attacked a suspected thief in the Nakawa division of Kampala. Police intervened to rescue the victim, and used live rounds to disperse the mob. The victim later died of his injuries. [size=small]
On or around October 17th, residents blocked the Busajjabwakuba road in Nakaloke (Mbale district), protesting the poor condition of the road. [size=no report]

On October 18th, a lynch mob (including boda boda drivers) killed a suspected motorcycle thief in Luwero town (Luwero district) and torched the body. Another suspect fled from the crowd and took shelter at a nearby police station, which the mob then attempted to storm, before being dispersed by tear gas fired by police. [size=no report]

column9: Government of Uganda (1986-); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
column17: On October 18th, residents of Kayabwe brawled with local politicians at a meeting in Kayabwe (Mpigi district), following disagreements on local security and administrative issues. Police intervened to stop the fighting. [size=small]

column16: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer; Chimp Reports
column17: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. Several students were also arrested as they attempted to march to President Museveni's state house. [size=large]
On October 22nd, 2019, student protesters (led by women) demonstrated at Wandegeya police station (Kampala), following the arrest of student demonstrators that same day. [size=no report]

column16: Chimp Reports; Weekly Observer; URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda)
column17: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with 100 students arrested and beaten on the second day of protests. [size=large]

On October 24th, men in police and army uniforms (and coded as such) attacked Gazi market in the dispute Apaa area (Adjumani district, coordinates for Apaa used at prec2). The attackers destroyed market stalls, fired live rounds, and arrested 2. 2 people are also reported to be missing.

On October 24th, a People Power activist was beaten unconscious and abducted by an unknown group of men in Kamwokya (Kampala). She was held for four days (during which time she was interrogated on her political activities), and released in Kawempe.

column16: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda)
column17: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. [size=large]

On October 25th, 2019, demonstrators gathered on Saaka road in Fort Portal (Kabarole district), in protest at the poor condition of the road. Demonstrators blocked the road with rocks, logs, and dug trenches. [size=no report]

column6: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On October 25th, Congolese militiamen in army fatigues (suspected of belonging to the Lendu ethnic group, and coded as such) attacked a group of Ugandan fishermen at Kaiso landing site close to Tonya (Hoima district, coordinates used), attempting to rob them, and killing three.

column16: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); Chimp Reports
column17: On October 25th, 15 journalists covering a student press conference (which was addressing the unrest at Mekerere University over the previous three days) were beaten and had tear gas fired upon them by police forces at Makerere University (Kampala).

On or around the weekend of October 26th-27th, Kenyan Turkana raiders attacked areas around Nakapelimoru (Kotido district), killing one 14 year-old boy, and abducting a 12 year-old boy. The attackers looted 2,000 head of cattle and hundreds of sheep and goats, and displaced hundreds of Karamojong civilians. The attacks come amidst a spate of raids in Kotido. Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

On or around the weekend of October 26th-27th, Kenyan Turkana raiders attacked areas around Nakapelimoru (Kotido district), killing one 14 year-old boy, and abducting a 12 year-old boy. The attackers looted 2,000 head of cattle and hundreds of sheep and goats, and displaced hundreds of Karamojong civilians. The attacks come amidst a spate of raids in Kotido. Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

On October 29th, police and UPDF fired upon a group of demonstrators who had reportedly attacked them during voting in Palarinya (Moyo district). A woman was shot in the head, but appears to have survived. [size=small]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On October 29th, soldiers from the FPU raided several homes in or near Kisalaizi parish (Nakasongola district), beating fisherman and other labourers. A woman was killed in the process, and eight civilians wounded, one of whom died at a later time, implied to be shortly after. Soldiers have claimed they were responding to aggression from one fisherman, who attacked a soldier with a bladed weapon. (Event coded as VAC/Attack)
On October 29th, police fired tear gas against journalists covering protests at Markerere University (Kampala), and arrested three.

On October 29th, students gathered at Markerere University (Kampala), as part of sustained demonstration against a cumulative fee increase. Police fired tear gas against demonstrators. [size=no report]

On October 29th, over 100 village chairmen demonstrated at the District HQ in Budaka town (Budaka district), following the non-payment of money promised to them for their role in an immunisation campaign in the area. [size=100]
On October 30th, pork vendors marched in Kabale (Kabale district), calling for a quarantine on pigs from the area (imposed due to an outbreak of swine fever) to be lifed. [size=40]

On October 30th, protesters gathered at Makerere Univeristy (Kampala) as part of continued protests against a cumulative fees increase. Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On October 30th, police fired tear gas inside a student dormitory in Makerere neighbourhood (Kampala), after its residents began whistling at them. The police then fired at journalists covering the events.

On October 30th or 31st, residents of Forest Ward on the outskirts of Gulu marched to the Resident District Commissioner's office in Gulu (Gulu district), to demand that two local politicians be released. The politicians are accused of mobilising a mob to clear a witch doctor off land in the area. [size=hundreds]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On October 31st, four Ugandan fisherman were abducted by suspected Congolese militiamen at Lake Albert, after they set of from their landing site at Kijangi (Hoima district, coordinates for Kabanda used at precision). The abductors are demanding a ransom. The event is the latest in a series of attacks against Ugandan fishermen.

On November 1, 2019, two police officers beat a civilian with batons and threatened to kill him, before robbing him, in or near Ruhaama town (Ntungamo district). The attack comes amidst a spate of similar attacks by police on residents of the area.
On November 1st, police arrested student demonstrators at Gulu University (Gulu district) who were protesting in solidarity with colleagues at Makerere University. [size=70]

On November 1, 2019, Balaalo pastoralists attacked three civilians (including an LC1 chairman) at Alinyiri village (Arua district, coordinates for Rigbo used at geoprec2). The attack appears to relate to disputes over access by the Balaalo to land in the area.
On November 4, 2019, journalists demonstrated in Kampala against infringements against press freedom by Ugandan security organs. Police beat several journalists and arrested one. [size=small]

On November 4, 2019, FDC supporters held a demonstration in Kireka (Wakiso district). Police used tear gas and water cannons against supporters. Video footage emerged of police smashing the vehicle of former FDC leader Dr Kizza Besigye and threatening its inhabitants with a firearm, before filling the vehicle with pepper spray. Dr Besigye was arrested, along with a number of his aides; eight FDC supporters were later arrested. [size=large]

column7: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Women (Uganda)
column17: On November 6, 2019, police prevented a march of female FDC supporters at the FDC headquarters in Najanankumbi (Kampala). Reports (which are not enitrely consistent) say that police fired tear gas into the office building after protesters threw stones and other items at the police (another report does not mention stone-throwing; actor 1 provisionally coded as Rioters and SET as Violent Demonstration). [size=dozens]

On November 12, 2019, a mob of parents attacked a primary school teacher at Lacor (Pader district, coordinates for Atanga used at prec2), after he had repeatedly showed up at work drunk. Police intervened and took the teacher into custody. [size=small]

On November 13, 2019, two suspected cattle ruslters (of Congolese nationality) were killed by a lynch mob at Ambaku village (Maracha district, coordinates for Oluvu used at geoprec2). [size=no report]

On November 19, 2019, striking workers at the Bidco industrial plant in Masese (Jinja district) demonstrated, against poor working conditions, unpaid overtime, arbitrary taxation from the company, and job insecurity. [size=1000]

On November 21, 2019, police dispersed Bobi Wine's People Power supporters with tear gas as they marched at the funeral of Human Rights Commissioner Haj Muhammad Kaggwa (known by his alias of Med Kaggwa) at Lufaka village on the outskirts of Mpigi town (Mpigi district, coordinates for Mpigi used at prec2). [size=500]

On November 23, 2019, taxi drivers blocked roads with their vehicles in Nansana (Wakiso district) in protest at the presence of a rival group of taxi drivers who have recently been moved to a nearby taxi stage. [size=no report]
On 26 November 2019, road workers protested at the local authority offices at Busia (Busia district), demanding salary arrears to be paid. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2019, protesters gathered in Kabowa (Kampala) to protest the closure of a footpath by a factor owner. A police officer fired several rounds at the protesters, shooting a demonstrator in the head, and killing him. The officer has been arrested. [size=no report]
On 27 November 2019, unemployed men demonstrated in Kampala against corruption and unemployment. Police arrested one protester, who was reported to be in possession of a machete. [size=no report].

On 27 November 2019, a lynch mob killed a local withdoctor after he (and two colleagues) were found at a Catholic shrine in Kazekolere (Burahya district, coordinates for Rutete used at geoprec2). The two colleagues escaped. Police have arrested six people in connection with the attack. [size=small]

On 1 December 2019, students attacked two men in Rukungiri (Rukungiri district), one of whom was alleged to have stolen clothes from a student dormitory. The students then handed the victims to the police. One of the victims died of his injuries the following day. [size=2]

On 4 December 2019, police prevented an anti-corruption march by the FDC party (designed to mirror a similar march led by President Museveni) in Mpererwe and surrounding areas of Kampala. Upon intercepting ex-FDC leader Dr Bisigye, FDC youths and police engaged in clashes. [size=no report]

On 5 December 2019, casual labourers working for the Ugandan Road Authority protested at the HQ of the authority in Kabale (Kabale district), having been unpaid since May of 2019. The manager of the authority has agreed to pay the workers by the end of the week. [size=30]

column7: Taxi Drivers (Uganda); NRM: National Resistance Movement
column17: On 5 December 2019, protesters (including boda boda drivers) - who are reportedly aligned to the NRM (and coded as such) - demonstrated in Kisenyi (Kampala), against a petition to have Museveni indicted at the International Criminal Court. Police dispersed the protesters. [size=dozens]

On or before 9 December 2019, UPDF exchanged fire with Kenyan Turkana raiders at an unspecified location in Napak district (coordinates for Napak town used at geoprec3). The raiders fled, and abandoned the cattle they had looted.

column16: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya
column17: On 11 December 2019, a Madi militia attacked Dinka refugees at Nyumanzi camp (Adjumani district), after the unexplained death of a Madi civilian in the camp the previous day. In the clashes between the Madi and Dinka, at least one Dinka refugee died (one report says six, though this is not corroborated by others), and injuring around 11 (some seriously, with injuries spread across both groups).
On 12 December 2019, police fired tear gas at People Power activists demonstrating in Kamwokya (Kampala), and made a number of arrests. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2019, Dinka refugees mobilised in retaliation for an attack the previous day, and attacked several Madi villages in Ajugotti parish (Linga, Maiciki, Ege, Jurumini and Maiaeiciki villages. One event coded at Jurumini, Adjumani district, at geoprec2). One Madi man was killed, and around 12 injured (some seriously). Dwellings were also torched, and looting occurred.

On 13 December 2019, market vendors burned tires on the roads at the Kame suburb of Mukono town (Mukono district), in demonstration against the failure of local authorities to re-establish electricity in the area. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2019, police arrested a number of People Power activists as they marched in Makindye (Kampala), and attempted to mobilise residents of the area to join the march. [size=small]

On 15 December 2019, members of the Palukere Acholi clan (armed with hand weapons and bows) attacked the Pali Pali Acholi clan in the area of Palukere (Amuru district), setting fire to 52 dwellings and stealing cattle, and displacing 500. A former army officer is linked to the attacks, which are variously described as being linked to a land dispute or for the death of the officer's brother (who may have died during the event, though this is unclear).

Around 15 December 2019 (month of), a lynch mob killed a suspected goat thief in or near Aduku (Kwania district). Seven people were arrested in June 2020 in connection with the killing. [size=at least 7]
On 16 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Karamajong raiders in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido district, coordinates for Nakapelimoru used at geoprec2), killing three and arresting one.

On 16 December 2019, a mentally ill man with a panga was intercepted by a mob in the village of Namayonjo (Nakasongo district; coordinates for Kisalizi used at geoprec2). The brother of the man intervened and the mob to release him, but a police officer shot the man dead, claiming he had become violent.

On 17 December 2019, demonstrators (coded as rioters) attempted to dig up boundary pillars which had been put on disputed land at Namakole (Mbale district). Riot police fired into the crowd, hitting a civilian who was not involved in the demonstration, and who died of his wounds shortly after. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 17 December 2019, protesters demonstrated at Moroto and the nearby Kidepo barracks (Moroto district, one event coded), following the killing of an LCIII chairman earlier that day. Soldiers (coded as LDU) dispersed at least some of the demonstrators. [size=hundreds]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 17 December 2019, an LCIII chairman attempted to prevent Local Defence Unit soldiers from seizing cattle (taken due to allegations they had been rustled). He was then shot dead by an LDU. The incident occurred at Kidepo army barracks (Moroto district).

On 17 December 2019, a lynch mob killed a suspect in a defilement case who had been released on bail in Lopulingi parish (Lamwo district), after he became involved in a brawl with his family. [size=small]

On 18 December 2019, residents of Hamurwa sub-county marched from Hamuko to Hamurwa (Rubanda district, coordinates used at geoprec2), in opposition to the very poor quality of the road in the area, and the absence of improvements despite the allocation of money for the road. Police prevented the demonstrators from proceeding, although allowed 11 chairpersons of villages to continue the march. [size=500]
On 19 December 2019, UPDF ambushed suspected Matheniko raiders at an unspecified location in Kotido district (coordinates for Kotido town used at geoprec2), killing three and capturing one.

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 19 December 2019, the Ugandan parliament has suspended the operations of the UPDF Fisheries Unit, following numerous reports of abuse and torture linked to the Unit. It is unclear how long the suspension will last for.

On 21 December 2019, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves and burned their bodies. The incident occurred in Kitgum (Kitgum district), and one accomplice of the suspect thieves escaped. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 23 December 2019, the UPDF Fisheries force entered Bugulu landing site (Buvuma district, coordinates for Kirongo used at prec2), assaulting residents and confiscating property. The event occurred despite the Ugandan parliament suspending the unit, following multiple incidents in which it abused civilians.
On 24 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Kenyan Pokot raiders near Nakapiripirit town (Nakapiripirit district), killing two Pokot raiders.

On 25 December 2019, UPDF clashed with cattle raiders from Kotido district in Rupa sub-county (Moroto district). The source describes two of the raiders as being ""put out of action"", and have been coded as fatalities at fatality prec2.
On 25 December 2019, a lynch monb attacked two suspected thieves in Gulu town (Gulu district). Police intervened to save the two suspects. [size=small]

On 25 December 2019, police shot and killed a civilian during an problem at a nightclub in Mukatesani (Rukungiri district, coordinates for Mutozho used at geoprec2). Police have claimed they were attacked by the patrons of the club.
On 27 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Jie raiders at Loputuk village in Nadunget sub-county (Moroto district, coordinates for Nadunget used at geoprec2), killing one Jie raider.

On 29 December 2019, unexploded ordnance (believed to have been from violence dating back to the counter-insurgency against the LRA) detonated in Latigi Parish (Pader district), killing a civilian who had accidentally damaged it whilst gardening.

On 30 December 2019, a lynch mob attempted to kill a suspect bike thief in Mukono town (Mukono district), before attacking a police officer who had come to intervene. Police reinforcements arrived, and dispersed the mob with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

column16: Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); AP
column17: On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Kasangati (Wakiso district) to welcome Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police blocked the road and arrested Bobi Wine, before firing tear gas and rubber bullets at his supporters (who were reported by police to have blocked roads with wood and tires, and engaged in clashes with police, and have been recorded as rioters pending further information), with one police officer wounded by a stray rubber bullet. (Note that initial reports claiming that an infant had died from inhaling tear gas were incorrect, according to police) [size=no report]

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters demonstrated in Kasangati (Wakiso district) against measures by authorities to prevent Bobi Wine MP from launching Consultative Meetings as part of his Presidential run. Police claimed that the supporters threw stones at police, wounding one officer, and that ""many"" were arrested. [size=at least many]

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Gayaza (Wakiso district) for a rally in support of the movement and of Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police arrested several protesters who refused to vacate the area, and fired tear gas upon the crowd. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
column17: On or after 6 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Kitsatsa village in Bumayoka subcounty (Bududa district, coordinates for Bufuma used at geoprec2). UWA - who were conducting operations in the area at the time - are suspected of killing the civilian, and have been coded as actor1.

On or after 7 January 2020, boda boda drivers protested in Mukono town (Mukono district), carrying the body of a colleague (who had been killed after being hit by a commercial taxi) to the police station, and demanding the release of their colleagues who had earlier attempted to mobilise boda drivers for a demonstration. [size=100]

On 7 January 2020, a lynch mob comprising South Sudanese refugees attempted to kill a man suspected of murdering two refugees. A police officer intervened, but one refugee took the officer's weapon and shot the officer dead. The event occurred in Onyire village (Moyo district, coordinates for Logoba used at geoprec2). [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
column17: On or after 8 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Sosomi in Buluganya subcounty (Bulambuli district, coordinates for Buluganya used at geoprec2). UWA - who were conducting operations in the area at the time - are suspected of killing the civilian, and have been coded as actor1.

On 8 January 2020, two UPDF soldiers were stabbed by three Karamajong raiders at a water pump in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido districts). The raiders then stole the weapons of the wounded soldiers.

As reported on 10 January 2020 (and implied to have occurred recently; time precision 3 used) a mob attacked milk vendors at an unspecified location in Ssembabule district, assaulting the vendors and vandalising their property. A local MP is suspected of organising the mob. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2020, miners marched to Ruhaama (Ntungamo district) from surrounding areas, in protest at alleged abuses by police officers directed towards them, and the low prices paid by a mineral trading firm in the area (which has a monopoly on trade). Police attempted to prevent demonstrators from marching, though were unsuccessful in doing so.[size=400]

On 10 January 2020, pastoralists staged a demonstration in Lwemiyaga (Ssembabule district) in which they attempted to take their cattle to sale at the market, despite a ban due to an outbreak of foot and mouth disease. Police arrested a local MP who organised the demonstration. [size=no report]

On or after 12 January 2020, members of the Karamajong ethnic group (coded as Karamajong militia) attacked members of the Teso group living in Apeitolim (Napak district), torching 24 dwellings, and killing a small child who was in one of them. The attack is a retaliation for a lynching that took place on 12 Jan. 20 were arrested following the attack.

On 12 January 2020, members of the Teso ethnic group lynched a Karamajong man in Apeitolim (Napak district) after he was spotted sharing a motorbike with the wife of a Teso inhabitant. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2020, two UPDF members guarding a cattle kraal were killed by Turkana fighters at Toruchup in Losilang parish (Kotido district). The attackers then stole the weapons belonging to the soldiers.
On 13 January 2020, anti-corruption activists marched in Kampala. Police intercepted the demonstrators, and arrested 13 organisers. [size=at least 13]

On 15 January 2020, four youths attacked the speaker of the Ntungamo district assembly at Ntungamo town (Ntungamo district) with pepper spray. The incident is reportedly linked to the speaker's intention to contest a seat of a former ally in upcoming elections. [size=4]

On 15 January 2020, a mob of boda boda drivers attempted to kill a suspected motorbike thief in Kalerwe (Kampala). Police intervened, and rescued the victim before he could be set alight. [size=no report]

During the month of January 2020, taxi drivers protested at the Kampala Capital City Authority HQ, calling for authorities to enforce recent changes to taxi stands in the city. The drivers say that some taxi drivers are not respecting the changes, which is penalising those who have adhered to them. [size=no report]
On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Jinja (Jinja district), but were dispersed by police, who beat an unspecified number of supporters in Masese III slum. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Mbale town (Mbale district) in a belated celebration of the 15 year anniversary of the formation of the party, but were intercepted by police, who also arrested the FDC party chairman. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, Turkana cattle raiders attacked Kamour village in Panyangara sub-county (coordinates for Panyangara, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2), and clashed with UPDF soldiers stationed at the village to prevent raiding. In the crossfire, four pastoralist teenagers were killed (one of whom died at a hospital having been injured in the gunfire).

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Soroti town (Soroti district), but were intercepted by police. FDC supporters threw stones at the police and burned tires in the roads, before police (and UPDF reinforcements) dispersed the crowd with tear gas and beatings, wounding three (including a six-month old child). Two police officers have been arrested. [size=no report]

column7: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Civilians (Uganda); Journalists (Uganda)
column17: On 22 January 2020, FDC supporters clashed with police in Jinja (Jinja district) during a rally in the town, whilst the ex-FDC leader was arrested (alongside a journalists who was conducting a radio interview with the ex-leader). [size=no report]

On 24 January 2020, a man was injured by unexploded ordnance (likely left from fighting between the UPDF and LRA) in Wilul village in Paicho sub-county (coordinates for Paicho, Aswa county, Gulu district, used at geoprec2).
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Muhanga (Rukiga district). [size=no report]

On 27 January 2020, members of the Koki clan of the Acholi attacked Kalabong (Kitgum district), in a revenge attack directed at members of the Yom clan following the killing of a Koki teenager several days before. The source does not mention whether anyone was injured, and instead notes that property was vandalised and looted.
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Rubanda town (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

column9: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit; Private Security Forces (Uganda)
column17: On 28 January 2020, residents of Kalerwe suburb (Kampala) attacked private security with stones and set up barricades, in demonstration against an operation to shut down illegal electricity connections. Police, UPDF, and LDUs (who had accompanied the private security) were also present, and police (coded as actor1) used tear gas to disperse the crowds. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2020, residents of Odolo village in Morulem subcounty barricaded a road in Rackoko parish (no geographic information found, coordinates for Morulem town, Abim district, used at geoprec2), after their area was once again excluded from road improvement works, and amidst allegations that the engineer in charge of the project was profiting from selling materials required for the road. The demonstration lasted at least three days. [size=no report]

During the week beginning 3 February 2020, security forces (coded as army) clashed with raiders from Kotido district (coded as Jie militia) at an unspecified location in Kotido district close to the border with Orom subcounty in Kitgum district (coordinates for Lobul, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2). One cattle raider was killed.

On 5 February 2020, a lynch mob killed a business man linked to the murder of his sister as he was hiding in Butabo cell in Ruhinda subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Mitoma, Ruhinda county, Mitooma district, used at prec2). Police have arrested four in connection with the vigilante action. [size=at least 4]

On 5 February 2020, over 800 teachers from several schools demonstrated during a training event at a school in Iganga town (Iganga district), in protest against unwelcome changes to the curriculum, and against a miserly stipend to cover transport to the school. Police intervened and arrested one teacher. [size=over 800]

On 6 February 2020, raiders from Karamajong (and coded as such) clashed with a UPDF soldier guarding a kraal at Katabok village in Lokopo subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Napak, Lokopo subcounty, Napak district, used at geoprec2). The soldier was killed and his weapon taken by the raiders.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 7 February 2020, around 30 men armed with pangas (and accompanied by 3 LDU paramilitaries) attacked farmers working on land belonging to a Christian University in Ntaawo (Mukono district), wounding six, and destroying crops and property on the farm. The violence is linked to a land dispute involving a businessman.

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
column17: On 7 February 2020, a civilian from Kapkoros subcounty was shot and wounded by a UWA park ranger after he was discovered (with others) grazing his livestock at an unspecified part of Mt. Elgon National Park (coordinates for Kapkoros, Kongasis county, Bukwo district, used at geoprec2). The UWA have claimed the attack was in self-defence, after the group resisted arrest, and the victim attempted to attack the park ranger (event coded as VAC pending further info).

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 7 February 2020, two fishermen were pursued by alleged members of the Fisheries Protection Unit (and who have been coded as such) at an unspecified area near Bussi island (coordinates for Gulwe, Busiro county, Wakiso district, used at geoprec2). Upon apprehending the men, the FPU soldiers cut off their hands. There is no clear motive. Four people have been arrested.

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 7 February 2020, Matheniko fighters shot dead an LDU paramilitary guarding a cattle kraal in the Lapan Namigut area (Napak district), and stole his weapon.

On 8 February 2020, truck drivers blocked the Kampala-Masaka road at Lukaya town (Kalungu district), calling for the release of a colleague of theirs who had been arrested for failing to pay a fine related to avoiding weighing station. [size=no report]

On 8 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district), following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. [size=no report]

On or before 11 February 2020, parents and students of a primary school in Kasongi in Lugusuulu subcounty (Mawogola, Ssembabule) protested following the unexpected movement of the schools' headteacher to Ntuusi subcounty, calling for authorities to leave the headmaster in place. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district) following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. Police used tear gas and live rounds into the air to disperse the demonstrators, who had blocked the roads. [size=no report]

On 14 February 2020, an Imam was killed by at least four unknown attackers in Busimba in Iwemba subdistrict (Bugiri district). Four people have been arrested; police have accused the ADF rebel group of being involved, although this is not confirmed.

On 14 February 2020, over 500 casual workers from a tungsten mine in Karra parish (Rubanda district) demonstrated following the abrupt closure of the mine by its international owners, which has left many without an income. Police prevented the demonstrators from marching to Rubanda town to lodge their grievances. [size=over 500]

On 14 February 2020, Democratic Party youth protested (and interrupted) at a party meeting which they believed would remove the Party Organising Secretary (supposedly on the grounds that he supported the People Power movement). The demonstration happened in the Mengo area of Kampala. Police were deployed, but did not become involved. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 16 February 2020, a fisherman was shot dead and another wounded by a UPDF Fisheries patrol near Kisenyi village on Lake Albert (Rubirizi district). The UPDF Fisheries spokesman alleged that the soldiers acted in self-defence, and were being threatened by the fishermen, who were attempted to hit them with their oars.

On 18 February 2020, hundreds of boda boda drivers marched in Kampala claiming that police were harassing them. The demonstrators were blocked by police, leading to clashes. Police used tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be fired into the air) to clear the demonstrators. [size=hundreds]

On 19 February 2020, students rioted at Kigezi College in Kabale town (Kabale district), after a student was suspended for extorting other students. His colleagues threw stones at teachers and damaged property, before attempting to torch the headteachers' residence. Police used tear gas and fired live rounds into the air to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020, a ""scuffle"" broke out between the supporters of an academic and police outside of a courthouse in Kampala, following the quashing of her conviction for insulting the President. Live rounds were fired into the air to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020, over 60 residents of rural areas around Njeru demonstrated in Njeru town (Buikwe district), calling for compensation after a private company damaged property and crops in their villages. [size=over 60]

On 23 February 2020, a lynch mob comprising of boda boda drivers (and possibly others) attempted to kill a suspected thief in Kakumiro town (Kakumiro district). Police intervened and opened fire, hitting three (including another police officer) with live rounds, including a student who died from their injuries. [size=no report]
On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Kumi (Kumi district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Ngora (Ngora district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. Police arrested over 30 demonstrators. [size=at least 30]

On 24 February 2020, People Power supporters clashed with police in Ndeeba, after police prevented them from holding a meeting. Tires were burned by the PP supporters, whilst police used tear gas and live rounds against the demonstrators, and arrested six. [size=at least 6]

column7: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 24 February 2020, police and LDU paramilitaries fired tear gas at FDC supporters holding a political rally in Njeru (Buikwe district). [size=no report]

On 24 February 2020, police fired tear gas and live rounds (assumed aerial fire) in Kabale town (Kabale district) at People Power supporters participating in a rally, held amidst student elections at the University in Kabale. [size=no report]

On 25 February 2020, youth blocked a road in Nakulabye (Kampala), calling for the body of a man shot dead by an LDU soldier in Nansana that same day to be returned to the family (who reside in Nakulabye). The youth engaged in ""running battles"" with the police, who later agreed to return the body, on the condition that politicians did not attend the funeral. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 25 February 2020, police and LDU paramilitaries dispersed People Power supporters with tear gas and live rounds as they demonstrated in Nansana (Wakiso district), following the burial of a colleague killed in a motor accident. One demonstrator killed after being shot in the head by an LDU soldier, and several demonstrators wounded. Authorities have alleged that the demonstrators threw stones at the police, and are investigating the shooting. [size=at least several]

column7: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
column17: On 25 Feb 2020, police arrested three land rights activists in Kisalanda village near Kakwoko (Kiryandongo district), transferring them to prison, where they were tortured. Upon their release on bail on 12 March, their houses were bulldozed.
On 25 February 2020, a man (who was accused of sexually assaulting an underage girl) was killed by a lynch mob in Mungaaro village in Bubaare subcounty (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

On 26 February 2020, residents of Kyagunda village in Bukulula subcounty (Kalungu district) blocked a road required by a Chinese infrastructure contractor, following complaints that the drivers of the company were damaging houses and crops in the area, and driving recklessly. [size=no report]

On 26 February 2020, FDC members protested in Jinja town (Jinja district), following the arrest of the former party leader earlier that day (he had been due to address a rally). There is no further information. [size=no report]
On 29 Feb or 1 March 2020, residents of Kasese town (Kasese district) demonstrated against a shortage of medicines at the local government health centre. [size=no report]
On 3 March 2020, students demonstrated in Moroto (Moroto district), due to a lack of clean water at the school. [size=no report]
On 3 March 2020, traders demonstrated in Kampala, following repeated electricity blackouts in Luwum street. [size=no report]
On 3 April 2020, residents of Busamba (Kisoro district) threw stones at soldiers on patrol, in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures, wounding one soldier. [size=no report]
On 4 March 2020, police arrested 10 People Power activists holding a private meeting in Jinja town. The police were reported to have beaten the activists.

On 6 March 2020, striking Ugandan bus drivers demonstrated at the Elegu-Nimule border post (presumed to be in Elegu, Amuru district), after a group of South Sudanese money exchangers attacked and broke the arm of a Ugandan bus driver in Nimule. [size=no report]

column9: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: URN (Uganda); West Nile Web; Daily Monitor (Uganda)
column17: On 6 March 2020, UPDF pursued an unknown communal militia (the majority of whom are suspected of being residents of Zombo district, and at least some who are likely to be Lendu militiamen from the DRC) who had attacked them earlier that day in Zombo, intercepting them at Zonga village in Patek parish (Zombo district). Dozens were arrested during and after the clash. The UPDF have announced that they killed 17 militiamen; media sources have given varying figures suggesting 20-23 were killed (with one report indicating that three militiamen were killed by local residents in the sub-county and in Nyapea). The UPDF has also disputed reports that the attackers were part of a new rebel group.

column7: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: Xinhua; Daily Monitor (Uganda); West Nile Web; Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda)
column17: On 6 March 2020, an unknown group of raiders (estimated by some sources at numbering around 100, with the majority believed to be Zombo district residents, and including at least some militiamen from the Lendu Congolese ethnic group) armed with basic hand weapons and bows attacked a UPDF base near Zombo town (Zombo district). Five UPDF were killed (at least one of whom dying of their injuries after the attack) and two were wounded. Initial information suggested that three of the attackers were killed, though this figure has been dropped from subsequent reporting. The attackers reportedly stole a small number of weapons. There is no clear motive for the attack at present; authorities have dismissed suggestions that the attackers are part of a new rebel group.

column9: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On or after 6 March 2020, residents of Zombo district were reported to have killed three unidentified attackers (mainly from Zombo district, but which also included several members of the Congolese Lendu group in their ranks) in Nyapea and/or Jangukuru areas of Okoro county (Zombo district).

On 7 March 2020, seven attackers armed with pangas killed a woman and her young daughter in Aoji village in Odoro parish, Aromo sub-county (Lira district). They then burned their house with the bodies inside. The attack is linked to an intra-clan feud. Those involved are likely to be of Lango ethnicity.

On 7 March 2020, the nephew of the former Ugandan vice-president under Idi Amin was abducted by suspected members of the Gimara clan of the Kakwa ethnic group at his farm in Anyanga village in Kuluba sub-county (Koboko district). His decomposing and dismembered body was discovered on 5 April. The killing is suspected to be linked to a land dispute.

On or around 8 March 2020, clan members of a woman killed in Aoji village in Odoro parish, Aromo sub-county (Lira district), burned 13 houses in Aloji in a revenge attack. The violence is linked to an intra-clan feud. Those involved are likely to be of Lango ethnicity.

On 9 March 2020, taxi drivers protested at the Kampala Capital City Authority HQ, calling for authorities to enforce recent changes to taxi stands in the city, following a similar protest in January. [size=no report]

On 10 March 2020, street vendors clashed with police in Kampala after police attempted to arrest a vendor. Police officers fired rubber bullets into the crowd, but shot one round into a teenage girl who was uninvolved in the event, knocking out three teeth. The girl's mother was hit in the arm with a rubber bullet, and another man was also wounded in the leg. [size=no report[

During the week commencing 9 March 2020, residents of Bugembe (Jinja district) burned rubbish on roads in the town, condemning the poor state of roads in the area. Police later arrested eight alleged ringleaders. [size=at least 8]

On 12 March 2020, police and military intelligence officers raided the home of retired Lt. Gen Henry Tumukunde (who announced that he would be running for the presidency against President Museveni the previous week) in Kololo (Kampala). The candidate was arrested and charged with treason in relation to remarks he made during a TV interview (allegedly inciting Rwanda to intervene in upcoming elections); his staff of 18, as well as the MP for Tororo North (his campaign coordinator) as well as his son have all been arrested.

On 14 March 2020, UPDF ambushed Karamajong raiders at Lakongera village, Chua county (Kitgum district). A civilian from nearby Apimoto village was wounded after two bullets hit him (possibly in the crossfire, although details are unclear). The civilian was taken by UPDF soldiers for medical treatment.
On 14 March 2020 (or possibly on 15 March 2020), demonstrators gathered in Jinja (Jinja district) to protest against the poor quality of the roads in the area. [size=no report]

column7: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 14 March 2020, Matheniko raiders (working alongside Turkana raiders from Kenya) attacked a kraal at Namaire in Panyangara subcounty (Kotido district). They engaged in a firefight with UPDF, LDU paramilitaries, and Police Anti-Stock Theft Unit personnel. One LDU and three Turkana raiders were killed, and five UPDF wounded.

On 15 March 2020, a lynch mob killed a man in Kategure village in Kyanamira sub-county (Kabale district), after he had thrown stones at the house of the LC1 Chairman of the village. Six have been arrested for leading the attack, including the LC1 Chairman. [size=at least six]

column7: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; PP: People Power; Students (Uganda)
column17: On 15 March 2020, People Power and FDC supporters demonstrated after police were deployed at student elections underway in Kyambogo University (Kampala). Police fired tear gas and live rounds (likely in the air) to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
column17: On 16 March 2020, Jie raiders shot a prison officer who was supervising inmates from Amita prison (Abim county) working at a nearby farm, and stole his weapon. The officer died of his wounds shortly after.

On 16 March 2020, a group of around 100 villagers from Guruguru village attacked Giragira village in Kilak county (Amuru district). In addition to abducting several residents of the village - and torching and looting property - the attackers gang-raped at least one woman. There is no clear motive for the attack mentioned in the source.

On 16 March 2020, demonstrators gathered once again in Jinja (Jinja district) to condemn the poor quality roads in the area. The demonstrators burned tires, placed rocks on the road, and dug trenches. Police fired tear gas and live rounds at the demonstrators, shooting a passer-by (who was not involved in the demonstration) in the hip. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2020, butchers protested in Kabale (Kabale district), after the abattoir constructed by local authorities was deemed to have failed to meet basic safety standards due to a lack of running water. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2020, a lynch mob attacked a woman they accused of practicing witchcraft in Rwengabi village in Kaseeta parish (Kikuube district). The mob beat her until she was unconscious. Police intervened to disperse the crowd, prompting the mob to throw stones at the police. Police responded by firing live rounds, but hit two of the crowd (with what are described as stray bullets). One man died the following day, and the other is critically injured. [size=no report]

On 19 March 2020, unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) beat a journalist who was taking photos of police shutting down a bar at an unspecified area of Kitgum district, under coronavirus lockdown measures.

On 19 March 2020, traders clashed with police at a market in Kisoro town (Kisoro district), after traders had previously been ordered to relocate to a different market. The traders threw stones at police, who fired live rounds at the traders, wounding two (one of whom was shot in the neck). [size=no report]

On 20 March 2020, a lynch mob attacked a Kenyan trader residing in Nampirika (Iganga district), accusing him of bringing coronavirus to Uganda after he developed a heavy cough. Although the man was beaten, he was able to escape, and fled to a nearby police station. [size=no report]

column16: Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer; PML Daily
column17: On 20 March 2020, the Ugandan government introduced a series of partial lockdown measures in anticipation of the coronavirus pandemic, including closures of schools, places of worship, and all demonstrations. The measures were tightened with border closures announced on 25 March, and a two-week lockdown came into force on 31 March. On April 14, it was announced that lockdown measures were to be extended until 5 May.
On 20 March 2020, a mob descended on a man accused of attempted rape and stabbed him to death in Lamogi (Lamogi, Kilak, Amuru). [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
column17: On 21 March 2020, Ugandan prison guards clashed with prisoners during a prison riot in Arua (Arua Hill, Arua Municipality, Arua). 3 prisoners were killed, 6 were injured, and 8 were recaptured as approximately 23 prisoners attempted to escape. It is unclear what prompted the rioting. [size=approximately 23]

On 21 March 2020, police fired tear gas and beat market traders who had turned up to Otuboi market (Kaberamaido district), in spite of a presidential ban on public gatherings to limit the spread of coronavirus. The source does not mention that the traders were demonstrating, nor that they fought back against the police.

On 21 March 2020, youths threw stones at soldiers in Kisoro town (Kisoro district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures, wounding one UPDF soldier in the leg. Two of the youths were arrested. [size=no report]

On 22 March 2020, a group of riders nearly lynched a businessman from South Africa in Kyabirwa village in Budondo sub-county (Kagoma, Jinja), after the man boasted of entering Uganda without having to quarantine for coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 23 March 2020, Ugandan police forces used live bullets to disperse crowds of traders in violation of coronavirus measures at markets in Bududa district and arrested an unknown number of them. Resulting injuries are unknown.
On 23 March 2020, soldiers were attacked by youths throwing stones in Rubaya (Mbarara district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 24 March 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by unknown people throwing stones at Nagagumba Trading Centre along the Sironko-Mbale road (event presumed to be in Sironko district, given that the majority of the road is in this district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
On 24 March 2020, unknown people threw stones at soldiers in Kampala, wounding a soldier in the mouth. The event occurs in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
On 25 March 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by youths throwing stones at Nyabyeya (Masindi district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 26 March 2020, LDU paramilitaries beat an unspecified number of market vendors and boda boda drivers (using wires and sticks) in Kampala, as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Several LDU members have been arrested in connection with the incident, and additional LDU officers have been arrested in connection with attempting to extorting individuals travelling in night-time hours.

On 26 March 2020, police shot and wounded two construction workers riding with a boda boda driver in Mukono (Mukono district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The police officers are being investigated.

On 26 March 2020, residents of Pamoju and Pamoti villages in Moyo district burned tyres on the road to Moyo town, after the government attempted to use an area near to the villages for coronavirus quarantining purposes. Police fired tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 27 March 2020, police beat a number of civilians at a bar in Busega (Kampala) whilst enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. The police attacked a heavily pregnant lady who had taken shelter from rain at the bar, and who was unable to flee the beatings. Three police have been arrested.

On 28 March 2020, the village of Vurra in Katiyi Parish (Arua district) was attacked by militia from the neighbouring Odrubu village in a Madi-inhabited area, as part of a land dispute. The attackers wounded 8 residents of Vurra, burned 13 dwellings, destroyed property, and stole food and livestock.
On 28 March 2020, police fired upon a group of six people in Bududa town (Bududa district), injuring one. The attack was ostensibly part of coronavirus enforcement measures.

On 29 March 2020, police and residents of Wakiso attacked a shelter for gay, lesbian, transgender and bisexual civilians in Wakiso (Waksio district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. 23 people were beaten and arrested.

As reported on 29 March 2020, Ugandan military intelligence personnel reportedly abducted and tortured at least two Rwandans who had been living in the area of Jinja (Jinja district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The source also states that the victims, along with 342 other Rwandans, were then left at the Rwandan border by Ugandan authorities.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 30 March 2020, LDU paramilitaries were reported to have attacked civilians in the Kawempe area of Kampala, ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Three of the LDUs have been convicted in a military court, and sentenced to short terms in prison.

On 31 March 2020, police fired tear gas at civilians observing police efforts to prevent non-essential staff and vendors from setting up stalls at the market in Kabale town (Kabale district), as part of coronavirus lockdown measures.

On 31 March 2020, police fired upon a boda boda driver in Kampala, after the driver failed to stop at a checkpoint, as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The driver was wounded in the buttocks. Police have claimed the driver grabbed a police officer, prompting them to shoot him.

On 31 March 2020, residents of Kayola (Busia district) threw stones at unspecified security patrols (presumed to be police), who were enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. There were no reports of injuries. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 31 March 2020, LDU paramilitaries beat a journalist and the driver of the boda boda he was travelling with in Makindye (Kampala), and insisted they be paid a bribe to release them. The attack was ostensibly related to coronavirus enforcement measures.
On or after 31 March 2020, security services (presumed to be police) beat an on-duty doctor in northern Kampala for violating the coronavirus lockdown measures introduced on 31 March.

On 31 March 2020, a police officer shot dead a boda boda driver in Kisimbiri (Wakiso district), after the driver had been in a dispute with another police officer who refused to pay him. The victim had been pinned to the floor by police and nearby civilians. Three police have been arrested in relation to the killing and deliberately mismanaging the case file to evade justice, and three civilians have also been arrested.

On 31 March 2020, police and UPDF were attacked in Kashozi (Sheema district) by ""drunkards"", in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. The bar owner who supplied the drinks was arrested. [size=no report]

On 31 March 2020, an unknown group carrying machetes attacked unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) at or near Majanji (Busia district). The attack comes in the context of the coronavirus lockdown measures. There is no further information.
On 31 March 2020, residents of Kawempe (Kampala) threw stones at a police officer, in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. The officer was injured on the arm. [size=no report]

On 1 April 2020, police and UPDF attacked and beat an on-duty journalist in Ntungamo (Ntungamo district) after he was taking photos of coronavirus lockdown measures. The security forces then stole his camera.
During the week beginning 30 March 2020, residents of Kabale town (Kabale district) threw stones at UPDF soldiers, in objection to their enforcement of the coronavirus curfew. [size=no report]

On and/or around 1 April 2020, police were alleged to have tortured and robbed civilians in and around Lwengo town (Lwengo district), under the cover of coronavirus enforcement measures. The district police commander, who has been linked to numerous abuses since being deployed in the area two years ago, is under investigation.

On 1 or 2 April 2020, market vendors demonstrated against the closure of the market in Kalerwe (Kampala), which had been closed on the grounds that it represented a public health risk and facilitated the spreading of coronavirus. Police dispersed the demonstrators through unspecified means. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 1 April 2020, unknown cattle raiders attacked an unspecified cattle kraal in Sidok sub-county (Kaabong district), killing an LDU paramilitary defending the kraal.

On 1 April 2020, protesters gathered in Mukono (Mukono district) to contest the delayed issue of travel permits. Bodyguards of the police commissioner attacked a journalist covering the protest, ostensible as part of coronavirus lockdown enforcement measures. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On or before 1 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries were reported to be removing residents from their homes in the Kulambiro area of Kampala, and beating them. The attacks appear to be linked to coronavirus enforcement measures, though it is unclear if the victims were caught violating the measures.

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 1 April 2020, three Kenyans on a motorbike (with two machetes) attempted to cross to Uganda at Busia (Busia district), and were reported to have attacked LDU paramilitaries and police. The attack comes in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. Police fired three shots at the attackers, who fled back to Kenya.

column7: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Unidentified Armed Group (Uganda)
column17: At an unspecified time between 22 March and 17 April 2020, the RDC of Jinja, together with men in military uniform and non-uniformed men beat and killed a businessman they had arrested and taken to a police station in Lwanda (Jinja district), ostensibly whilst enforcing coronavirus measures, before stealing possessions from the victims' property. The local official and two others have been arrested in connection with this attack and various other abuses committed under the guise of coronavirus enforcement measures.

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 1 April 2020, an LDU paramilitary was attacked by youths in Malaba (Tororo district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. There is no further information. [size=no report]

column16: Reuters; URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Acholi Times
column17: On 2 April 2020, UPDF and police beat 32 women and 6 men at Lorokwo West village near the Elegu border post (Amuru district), and forced some of the victims to remove their clothes and roll in mud. The attacks were ostensibly part of coronavirus enforcement (specifically to disperse overcrowded buildings and what police claimed were brothels). Six soldiers were subsequently sentenced to six months jail time, and 10 police officers are under investigation.

On 2 April 2020, traders blocked the main road at Wandegeya (Kampala), burning wood to prevent traffic passing. The demonstration appears to be in opposition to coronavirus enforcement measures. Police extinguished the fires, but the source does not mention whether they dispersed the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column9: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit; Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
column17: On 2 April 2020, residents of Busia town (Busia district) threw stones at UPDF, police, and LDU paramilitaries, who were enforcing the coronavirus curfew. Two police officers were wounded; security forces then beat up residents of the town. [size=no report]
On 2 April 2020, a journalist was ""severely beaten"" by unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) in Mukono (Mukono district), whilst covering coronavirus curfew measures.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 2 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries beat a journalist in or near Nakisunga (Mukono district), for violating the coronavirus curfew. The journalist entered a coma for ten hours but was revived; an LDU officer has been arrested.

On 2 April 2020, residents of an unspecified location in Mitanya district attacked a soldier (presumed to be UPDF), who was enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures, fracturing his leg. [size=no report]
On 2 April 2020, youths threw stones at soldiers on patrol in Kabale town (Kabale district), in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
column17: On 3 April 2020, a prison guard hit an elderly lady (who was being transported on a boda boda) in the head twice with his rifle butt in Giligili (Arua district), ostensibly for violating coronavirus curfew regulations.

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 3 April 2020, raiders (suspected of coming from Kotido district) attacked a cattle kraal at Kanakora in Kakamar subdistrict (Kaabong district). LDU paramilitaries guarding the kraal engaged in a firefight with the raiders, killing three. Two residents of the village (including a young teenager) were also killed, and one may have been injured in this raid or another that took place in the same area. A small number of cattle were stolen.

On 4 April 2020, a militia said to be in the pay of a businessman attacked the villages of Bukoba and Bukompe in Nalutuntu parish (Mubende district), as part of an effort to evict residents from land they had previously purchased from an MP. Reports indicate that at least one woman was gang-raped; numerous people beaten; and property destroyed and looted. The businessman and an accomplice have been arrested, as have four police accused of abetting the businessman.

column9: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 4 April 2020, ""big numbers"" of residents blocked roads with large rocks in Koti, west of Kapchorwa town (Kapchorwa district), after authorities closed the Koti trading centre for not abiding by coronavirus social distancing measures. UPDF and LDU paramilitaries fired live rounds at the demonstrators, seriously wounding a teenage girl who was shot in the neck. [size=big numbers]
On 4 April 2020, a group armed with machetes and stones attacked two police officers in Kawempe (Kampala), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. There is no further information.

On 5 April 2020, police raided a house in Kijongo (Hoima district), after falsely accusing a woman of sheltering others attempting to evade the coronavirus curfew. The officers beat the woman, and destroyed household items and food.

On 5 April 2020, youths were reported to have attacked a UPDF patrol in Arua town (Arua district), in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures. There is no further information. [size=no report]

column7: Refugees/IDPs (Burundi); Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 5 April 2020, Burundian refugees awaiting registration at Nakivale settlement (Isingiro district) rioted after they were denied food. Ugandan police fired at the refugees, killing 1 Burundian refugee, 1 Congolese refugee (a young child), and one of unspecified origin. Another man was wounded. [size=at least four]
On 5 April 2020, residents of Kankoba (Kiryandongo district) threw stones at soldiers on patrol, in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures. [size=no report]

On 5 April 2020, unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) were attacked by youths throwing stones at Birongo (Kalungu district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. An officer was wounded in the eye, and six youths were arrested. [size=at least six]
On 5 April 2020, youths threw stones at soldiers on patrol in Kamakamu in Rigbo subcounty (Arua district), in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures. [size=no report]

On or around 6 April 2020, police were alleged to have beaten and extorted civilians in their homes in or around Otuke town (Otuke district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Three police officers have been arrested.

On 6 April 2020, health workers (including doctors and nurses) and medicine-delivery drivers demonstrated at the Ministry of Health HQ in Kampala, against the failure of authorities to distribute travel exemption stickers, without which workers have been unable to pass coronavirus security checkpoints. [size=no report]

On 6 April 2020, nine youths torched the house of a man at Pagoro village in Lamogi subcounty (Amuru district) after he reported them to authorities for violating coronavirus social distancing measures. Three have been arrested, six are at large. [size=nine]

On 6 April 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by youths throwing stones at Omukinaku area of Itendero Town Council (Sheema district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. Several police were wounded, and an unspecified number were arrested. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 6 April 2020, 5 Kenyan youths threw stones at Ugandan LDU paramilitaries in Busia town (Busia district) on the Kenya-Uganda border, after the LDU's prevented the youths from crossing. An LDU was wounding on the arm. [size=five]
On 6 April 2020, residents of an unspecified location in Rigbo subcounty (Arua district) threw stones at soldiers on patrol, in the context of coronavirus enforcement measures. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2020, a mob threw stones at UPDF reservists enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures in Kalungu district, wounding one reservist. His colleagues took him to a health centre close to Birongo (Kalungu district), where the same group threw stones once more. One soldier then fired upon the youth, killing one. [size=no report]

As reported on 7 April 2020, UPDF and police were reported to have beaten civilians in their homes in several parts of Ntoroko town (Ntoroko district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures.
On 7 April 2020, residents of Katuna (Kabale district) threw stones at police who were enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. There were no injuries. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2020, police clashed with market vendors in Mbale town (Mbale district), after police enforced a temporary close of the market as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Police used tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be fired in the air) to disperse the traders. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2020, police were attacked by youths throwing stones at Nyaruszia (Kisoro district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures, causing minor injuries to the police patrol. [size=no report]
On 7 April 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by four youths throwing stones at Karuma (Kiryandongo district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=four]

On 7 April 2020, police were attacked by youths throwing stones at Karengere (Kisoro district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. Police fired live rounds in the air, dispersing the youth. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 7 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries fired upon a deaf man at Mugila village near Adilang (Agago district), after he did not comply with their orders to stop. Upon noticing the bullets, the man ran, and was shot in the leg (which was later amputated). The paramilitaries were enforcing coronavirus curfew measures at the time of the attack, though have subsequently claimed they mistook the victim for a cattle rustler.

On 8 April 2020, an unspecified security officer (presumed to be police) kicked a saucepan of boiling oil onto a female food vendor in Gulu (Gulu district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. The woman suffered severe burns to her chest. The officer was arrested but then released on bail.

On and/or around 8 April 2020, police were accused of entering the homes of residents of Kyabi in Kawanda parish (Ssembabule district) and beating and extorting residents, ostensibly as part of coronavirus lockdown measures. One woman was beaten and forced to undress at a police station, reportedly as police were attempting to find money they claimed was hidden about her person.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On or before 8 April 2020, a civilian was beaten in the head by an LDU paramilitary at or near Kabembe (Mukono district), as he was escorted a pregnant women to hospital during the coronavirus curfew hours.

On or before 8 April 2020, traders clashed with police at Watoni trading centre (Mukono district), as police attempted to remove traders who were not selling food from the market as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. One trader was shot in the leg by police. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2020, an unspecified security patrol (presumed to be police) was attacked by youths throwing stones at areas near Mutolere (Kisoro district),smashing the windscreen of the vehicle. The event occurred in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
On 8 April 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by youths throwing stones at Katuna (Kabale district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2020, police were attacked by youths throwing stones at Eniinzi (Isingiro district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. Police allege that a local politician mobilised the youth. [size=no report]

As reported on 9 April 2020, police were alleged to have beaten civilians in Atera ranch in Akokoro subcounty (Apac district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Two police were arrested.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 April 2020, UPDF engaged in a firefight with Congolese militiamen on the waters near Kaiso landing site (Hoima district), killing two, and arresting five. The UPDF were on their way to intercept the militiamen after reports of robbery in the area, when they were fired upon.

As reported on 9 April 2020, police were alleged to have beaten civilians in their homes in Onywako (Lira district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Two police are under investigation.

As reported on 9 April 2020, a police officer was alleged to have shot a civilian in Chegere sub-county (Apac district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. One officer was arrested. It was not reported whether the victim was injured or killed.
On 9 April 2020, police and UPDF were attacked by youths throwing stones at Kimengo (Masindi district), in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 10 April 2020, suspected Karamajong raiders clashed with LDU paramilitaries in the village of Tikau in Orom sub-county (Kitgum district), with one raider killed by the LDU.

On 10 April 2020, suspected Jie raiders attacked the villages of Locum, Lacwa/Lachua East and Leladwong in Paimol sub-county (Agago district), wounding six residents of the area with arrows. Residents killed one of the raiders, and burned the body.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Naval Forces
column17: As reported on 10 April 2020, UPDF clashed with FARDC Naval personnel at Lake Albert, after the Congolese vessel (which appears to have also been carrying non-military government officials) was reported to have crossed into Ugandan waters. At least three Congolese were killed (including a FARDC navy officer), and four taken captive in Hoima district. One source claims that 10 Congolese were killed, although this is not confirmed.
On 11 April 2020, police and UPDF were attacked with stones at Omubugando in Mitooma district, in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. An unspecified number were arrested. [size=no report]
On 11 April 2020, residents of Makindye threw stones at police in Makindye (Kampala), in the context of the coronavirus lockdown. [size=no report]

On 11 April 2020, youths attacked a Lance Corporal (presumed to be UPDF) at Giligili (Arua district), and attempted to steal the weapon of another soldier. One suspect was arrested. The incident occurred in the context of coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 11 April 2020, police and UPDF enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures were attacked in the Kitintale suburb of Kampala by ""drunkards"", with one police officer wounded. One person has been arrested. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: As reported on 12 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries attacked civilians in their homes in Ocorimongin (Katakwi district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Four LDU officers have been arrested in connection with attacks in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: As reported on 12 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries attacked civilians in their homes in Toroma (Katakwi district), including the local chairperson of the NRM, ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Four LDU officers have been arrested in connection with attacks in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: As reported on 12 April 2020, LDU paramilitaries attacked civilians in their homes in Katakwi (Katakwi district), ostensibly as part of coronavirus enforcement measures. Four LDU officers have been arrested in connection with attacks in the area.
On 12 April 2020, residents of Kisoro town (Kisoro district) threw stones at a UPDF patrol that was enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures, breaking the windscreen of a vehicle. [size=no report]
On 13 April 2020, residents of Nyakazinga in Mishenyi parish (Kanungu district) lynched a suspected thief after he was caught attempting to steal a solar panel. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
column17: On 13 and 14 April 2020, armed men (likely a combination of UWA personnel and local irregulars) attacked the villages of Acholiber and Punodyang in Pabbo sub-county (Amuru district), in the disputed Apaa area. The attackers torched houses (rendering 10 families homeless) and stole food.

On 13 April 2020, police fired tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be over the heads) of mourners at a funeral in Rwandaro village near Kichwamba (Rubirizi district), as part of coronavirus enforcement measures to limit public gatherings. It does not appear as though there were physical injuries.
On 13 April 2020, South Sudanese raiders attacked Pakinyi in Rudi parish (Lamwo district), severely beating a farmer. The attackers were believed to be cattle raiders.

column6: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
column17: On 13 and 14 April 2020, armed men (likely a combination of UWA personnel and local irregulars) attacked the villages of Acholiber and Punodyang in Pabbo sub-county (Amuru district), in the disputed Apaa area. The attackers torched houses (rendering 10 families homeless) and stole food.

On 14 April 2020, residents of Kisoro town (Kisoro district) threw stones at a UPDF patrol that was enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures, wounding a soldier (who was hit in the head by a stone). [size=no report]

As reported on 15 April 2020, youths playing football clashed with police at Mubuga (Kisoro district), after police attempted to disperse them under coronavirus lockdown measures. The police shot and wounded one youth in the leg. [size=no report]

As reported on 15 April 2020, residents of Gashenyi in the Gasovu area (Kisoro district) threw stones at unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) who were enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 15 April 2020, vendors demonstrated in Busia town (Busia district), after police attempted to enforce coronavirus lockdown measures (which would have closed a number of stalls). Police dispersed the vendors with tear gas and live rounds (presumed to have been fired over the heads of the vendors). [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
column17: On 15 April 2020, and LDU paramilitary shot and killed a college of his (seemingly in an act of friendly fire) and wounded a student following an attempt at stopping a boat from travelling at Kisima 1 island in Jinja district, as part of coronavirus lockdown enforcement measures. The boat was reported to have been carrying more than the permitted number of passengers.

As reported on 15 April 2020, residents of Russia in Kisoro municipality (Kisoro district) threw stones at unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) who were enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

As reported on 15 April 2020, residents of Nyakabaya (Kisoro district) threw stones at unspecified security forces (presumed to be police) who were enforcing coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]
