Assailants attacked a checkpoint near the National Bank in Central Arish, a police club in Arish injuring one security personnel and a resort in Arish on 27 July. Police forces returned fire.

Muslim youth and security forces protected Al-Azraa and Anba Ebram churches from attacks by alleged Morsi supporters in Minya. Muslim Brotherhood protesters ""vandalised shops in Palace Square, raided an Al-Dostour party exhibition and beat up Al-Dostour member Mahmoud Mamdouh and stole his phone""
Two photographers have reported being assaulted during the violence at the Rabaa Al-Adaweya sit-in

95 protesters and 1 policeman were killed in clashes that erupted between supporter of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi and the security forces. Witness accounts and video footage indicate that the security forces deliberately targeted protesters, firing teargas and birdshot, and then live ammunition. Government snipers shot at them while perched on nearby rooftops. Accounts also indicate that some protesters lobbed Molotov cocktails and fired birdshot at security forces as well, resulting in one policeman dying from birdshot wounds.
A university student, was shot and killed in Heliopolis, while two other students were badly injured after another vehicle opened fire on their car.
Egyptian security forces killed 10 ""militant"" gunmen and captured 20 in an operation in the Sinai Peninsula over the past 48 hours
In Kafr el-Zayat clashes broke out during the funeral of another Morsi supporter killed in Cairo. One man was killed.

Clashes between supporters and opponents of the Muslim Brotherhood, which erupted in Port Said left one dead and 28 injured. An eyewitness told Aswat Masriya that supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi opened fire on Mary Girgis Church as mourners passed through.
Militants fired a ballistic missile at the North Sinai Security Directorate building, injuring three officers and damaging the buildings third floor
A Christian was kidnapped at gunpoint in Sinai. Unknown gunmen kidnapped him when he was in front of his shop in Al-Arish.
Clashes broke out in Mahalla after the funeral of a Brotherhood member. Residents used sticks and broke cars to disperse Brotherhood members.
Clashes in Helwan, Cairo were reported between pro-Morsi demonstrators and local residents
Supporters of ousted President Muhammad Morsi head to 6 October Bridge [Cairo] and hurl Molotov cocktails at houses of Abu-Hashish area. They clashed with local residents.
Supporters of Egypts ousted president marched towards security headquarters in Cairo
At least 15 people were killed in a brawl between Cairo street vendors and a shopkeeper, including 13 in a fire

Altercations occurred among the supporters and the opponents of the ousted president in Zagazig after the supporters had chanted against the Armed Forces , angring the residents of the area, and resulting in the occurrence of clashes in which firearms and white weapons were used.
One soldier was killed and eight were injured in an attack on a military camp in Northern Sinais Rafah
Seventeen people were injured in confrontations that erupted between supporters and opponents of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Ismailiya

Hundreds of demonstrators who gathered at al-Nahda Square in front of Cairo University marched to embassies of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates to protest against the Gulf states support for the military oust of Morsi
Police recruit martyred in front of police station of third section of Arish by sniper shots
Different marches from Ramses Square and al-Nour mosque downtown headed to Rabaa Al Adawiya Square in Cairo

In Dakahleya governorate, an 18-year-old, died at Talkha hospital after supporters of the ousted President attacked him in front of the Olympic Village. They beat him with a piece of iron and then stabbed him with a sharp knife in his chest.

On July 30th, the Interior Ministry announced that it had found 11 bodies of apparent victims of torture from Raba and al-Nahda squares. Human Rights Watch examined evidence to suggest that some protesters within the sit-ins detained and abused a number of people regarded as suspected infiltrators.

On July 30th, the Interior Ministry announced that it had found 11 bodies of apparent victims of torture from Raba and al-Nahda squares. Human Rights Watch examined evidence to suggest that some protesters within the sit-ins detained and abused a number of people regarded as suspected infiltrators.

Unidentified armed men shot a 22-year-old policemen in the chest outside the Arish policeman station. He died before reaching hospital. On the same day, gunmen driving a 4x4 vehicle opened fire on the fire department in Arish, killing a 29-year-old soldier.
Clashes in Ashmoon involving around 400 people led to one person seriously injured and hospitalised. The police dispersed the clashes.
One person died and about 17 were injured after clashes broke out between protesters and local residents in Ismailiya. After the person was killed, four shops were set on fire
3 people were injured after rallies in Sadat led to clashes
Morsis supporters at Rabiah al-Adawiyah continue to secure square. Pro-Morsi protesters organized marches outside military intelligence headquarters in Cairo
The demonstrators at Rabaa continued their sit-in for the fifth week in a row. They set up barriers on all square entrances and sealed off side streets.
An explosive device detonated behind Sinai Sun Hotel in Arish city. No casualties reported
In Gizas Nahda Square, the demonstrators organized vigilante groups to monitor any attempt to infiltrate the sit-in or to disperse it.
Six Copts were injured in a Minya village after clashes with pro-Mursi demonstrators. The houses of several Copts and village churches were attacked by stones during a pro-Mursi march
A photographer working for Al-Masry Al-Youm newspaper said he was assaulted at the press centre at Rabaa Al-Adaweya and that his camera was stolen,
Central Security recruit killed in ambush that targeted security check point outside hotel in Al-Arish
Mass pro-Morsi marches have set off from some 33 mosques across Cairo and Giza under the slogan ""Egypt against the coup.""

Two policemen were wounded after supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi fired birdshot at them in clashes near the Media Production City in Cairos sixth of October district. A TV correspondent was also attacked. 31 MB members arrested.
Eight people were injured in clashes in Fayoum
Marches in support of the ousted president took place in the city of Suez
14 people injured in clashes that erupted in the Sharqiya governate between local residents and pro-Morsi demonstrators.
Several pro-Mursi rallies were also planned to in the cities eastern district of Smouha in Sidi Jabir
Mass pro-Morsi marches were held in Alexandria. A thousands-strong march converged outside the headquarters of the cities security directorate
Supporters of ousted Egyptian president Mohamed Morsi said they would march on two key military headquarters in Cairo
Two more marches in Cairo headed to the defence ministry in the Abbasiya neighbourhood
One soldier wounded in armed attack on security building in Al-Arish.
The pro-Morsi sit-in outside the Rabaa Al-Adawiya mosque was already packed by early afternoon. Demonstrators held aloft posters of Morsi as well as banners condemning what they term a ""coup detat""
Pro Mursi march departed Ramses Square after noon prayers, and arrived in Rabaa Al-Adaweya a number of hours later
In the Alf Maskan neighbourhood clashes were reported between residents and Morsi loyalists trying to set up a new protest site in the area.
One policeman has been injured in a militant attack on a police station in Al-Arish, North Sinai

Fifteen people were injured, including one police officer and three conscripts, in confrontations between supporters of ousted president Mohamed Mursi and residents of Minyas Beni-Ahmed village. Clashes broke out between Muslims and Christians after a dead body of a Muslim was found.

A central security forces conscript, was shot in the stomach after unidentified militants assaulted an Arish police station. On the same day, a conscript, was shot in his right shoulder when gunmen attacked the Arish Policemen Club.

A total of 34 marches were planned for Sunday, which would follow the same route as Fridays rallies, marching under the banner of ""Pray against Oppressors"" and would head for the sit-ins at Rabaa Al-Adaweya in Nasr City and Al-Nahda Square in Giza.
Supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi marched on Salah Salem Road early on Sunday, to ""deliver a message to the leaders of the coup,""

Two servicemen were wounded when gunmen attacked a checkpoint outside a bank in Al-Arish. On the same day, an armed group targeted the Armed Forces Club and hotel in Arish for the second time and one conscript was killed and two were wounded in a sniper shooting that occurred in Sinais Arish city
Fifty-five people were injured in clashes between supporters of Egypts deposed President Mohamed Mursi and their opponents in the new Damietta city located north of Cairo. 11 arrested.

Unknown assailants, thought to belong to an extremist religious group in North Sinai, used improvised explosive devices (IEDs) to blow up the shrines of two religious leaders. The first shrine belonged to Sheikh Hamid Abu Jarir, located in the Al-Mughara region of the city of Al-Hassana in Central Sinai.
Thousands of supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi marched to Cairos High Court on Monday, to demand the return of the deposed president
Demolition: Unknown assailants destroyed a shrine belonging to Sheikh Salim Ashraf Abu Jarir in the Mazar region in the city of Bir Al-Abd.
Defusal: Security forces in Al-Qalyubiyah deactivate three powerful homemade bombs outside Nasir Hospital in Shubra al-Khaymah.
16 people were left injured after overnight clashes in Beheira
Armed assailants attacked a police station with live ammunition in Arish. No casualties
At least one person was killed and 27 were wounded during late night clashes between the supporters and opponents of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi in Alexandria

Violence broke out between Nasr City residents and supporters of ousted president Mohammed Morsi near the Rabaa Al-Adaweya sit-in. Several residents were badly injured during the fighting; one suffered from a skull fracture after protesters attacked him with wooden sticks
Supporters of Egypts deposed President Mohamed Mursi marched in Cairos Nasr City
Pro-Mursi protesters marched in Maadis Courniche, also halting traffic there as they staged a protest outside the Supreme Constitutional Court.

Clashes erupted in Fayoum governorate south of Cairo when Brotherhood members allegedly attempted to break into the security directorate building as part of the ""break the coup,"" protest march. Police used teargas to disperse the attempt and the two sides exchanged birdshots. 28 injuries reported
In the town of Monshaet Abu Omar in Sharqiya, anti-Morsi and pro Morsi youth threw stones at each other, leading to minor injuries on both sides

The delta city of of Mahalla Al-Kobra witnessed clashes following prayers when pro-Morsi activists distributed anti-army flyers. Verbal exchanges turned into fist-fights in front of the mosque after some worshippers objected to the flyer. 4 injuries

Colonel Ali denied the Israeli drone claims and said the militants were targeted by Egyptian gunships. The group behind the attack was Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.

Hundreds at a women's march in central Cairo chanted against army chief Abdel Fattah al-Sisi
Pro-Muslim Brotherhood protesters rally at railway in Ramsis. Morsis supporters organize protests at Al-Shuhda station, block metro movement for 18 minutes.

Supporters of toppled President Mohammed Morsi increased the pressure on Egypts interim leadership by defiantly flooding into two protest camps Monday, prompting police to postpone moving against the 6-week-old sit-ins

Supporters of ousted President Mohamed Morsi marched on Monday to the High Court, demanding the removal of Prosecutor General Hisham Barakat
Police personnel staged sit-in outside police station in Minya to demand fulfillment of their demands.

Three incidents of violence were reported near the Rabaa Al-Adaweya Mosque in Nasr City. A bearded man wearing a blue helmet, shot at a civilian, injuring his right arm. A taxi driver was stopped by protesters at the sit-in asked him to show them his identity card, after which they started beating him, breaking his arm, and a man was detained in a tent and beaten; he reportedly saw around six other people who were tied up and blindfolded in the tent where he was detained.
Two people were arrested when military personnel dispersed a labour protest in the canal city of Suez
Hundreds of demonstrators waving Egyptian flags and carrying pictures of the deposed president marched through the central Cairo neighbourhood of Ramses
One person was killed and several others injured Tuesday night during clashes between the supporters and opponents of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi in Cairo
Protesters continue sit-in at Rabiah al-Adwiyah Square, Al-Nahdah Square.
A group of ""jihadist"" fighters said Tuesday they had fired a Grad rocket on the Israeli Red Sea town of Eilat in retaliation for an alleged Israeli air raid.
Protesters continue sit-in at Al-Nahdah Square.
One person was injured after a bomb planted by assailants near the military prosecutions headquarters in Arish exploded on Tuesday evening
Unknown assailants attacked a police station, a border checkpoint and a VIP cafeteria with local-made explosive devices in Sinais Arish, causing no casualties
A mob armed with rocks and petrol bombs attacked St Saviours Church and two schools in Suez
87 demonstrators were killed during the security operation to clear out the Muslim Brotherhoods sit-ins at Cairos Nahda Square, Xinhua reported.

87 demonstrators were killed during the security operation to clear out the Muslim Brotherhoods sit-ins at Cairos Nahda Square. Witnesses described how police fired at unarmed protesters both deliberately and indiscriminately, using teargas, birdshot and live ammunition.
Clashes broke out between Mursi supporters and security forces. Two police cars were also set on fire in Assiut, in addition to the judges club and multiple stores

Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi hit Alexandrias streets to voice their rejection of the security operation to clear out the sit-ins at Cairos Rabaa al-Adaweya and Nahda Squares. 15 people died and 282 injured in clashes around the city.

150 people killed in other governorates nationwide and 3, 717 others injured in the ""dispersal operation"" against pro-Morsi sit-ins in Cairo and Giza, as well as in relevant clashes in other governorates.

At least 817 people were killed during the security operation to clear out the Muslim Brotherhoods sit-ins at Cairos Rabaa al-Adaweya according to HRW. Some protesters threw stones, molotov cocktails and a minority were reported to have fired back at advancing security forces. The Forensic Medical Authority and National Council for Human Rights set the number of police officers killed in Rab'a at eight.

Hundreds of supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi have set fire to the Good Shepherd Church, the Franciscan School and two armored military vehicles in Suez. Five people, including a woman, were killed when clashes between security forces and supporters of former President Mohamed Mursi broke out
Supporters of former President Mohamed Mursi pushed an armored security vehicle from the top of October 6 Bridge in Cairo. Five soldiers were inside the vehicle
Property destruction: Security forces surrounding the field hospital building burnt it.
A mob burnt a church in Malawi, in the south of Minya
The church of the Holy Virgin in Nazla, Fayoum, Lower Egypt was torched by Muslim rioters
Clashes broke out between Mursi supporters and security forces
The church of Mar-Girgis, the church of St Michael on Nemeis Street and Coptic houses and shops in Assiut were burned
Clashes broke out between Mursi supporters and security forces
The bishopric church in Etfeeh, Giza was burnt by Islamists
The church of St Dimiana and the Evangelical church in the village of Zerbi in Fayoum were attacked and burnt.
The St Fatima Basilica in Cairo was attacked but not burned by Islamist rioters
4 churches in the Abu-Hilal area of Minya were attacked by Muslim Brotherhood rioters
Three journalists, including a cameraman for British broadcaster Sky News and a Dubai-based newspaper reporter, were killed and several were injured in the violence that erupted in Egypt
The church of Anba Antonius in Kerdassa, Giza was burnt by Muslim Brotherhood supporters
15 policemen were killed when supporters of President Mursi attacked a police station in Kirdasah
Coptic-owned shops, pharmacy, and hotels on Karnak Street and Cleopatra Street in Luxor (attacked and looted)

Scores of ousted President Mohamed Mursis supporters torched Mary Guirguis Church in Arish and destroyed its main gate. Three army offices were also burnt, including Al-Arishs office of recruitment and mobilisation.
Attackers also set two police vehicles on fire and attempted to storm Ber al-Abd police station in Arish

Thousands of protesters who support Egypts deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi burned down a Coptic Orthodox Church in Sohag. The protesters also set fire to a police car and seized weapons belonging to army soldiers. The church of Mar-Morqos (St Mark) and its community centre were also burned down.
Pro-Mursi protesters also torched a train carriage at Abu Qerqas.

Hundreds of Brotherhood supporters cut off the railway in Minya, causing traffic to come to a complete halt in the city. Elsewhere in the city, hundreds of Brotherhood supporters cut off Cairo-Aswan agricultural highway.
Pro-Mursi protesters have also blocked a highway that links the cities of Suez and Ismalia.

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood members attempted to break into Matai, Bani Mazar, Mallawi, Samallout and Abu Qerqas police stations and opened fire at them. Police forces engaged with the attackers and fired teargas to disperse them.
Two people were killed and 20 others were injured in clashes that broke out between former President Mohamed Mursis supporters and security forces at Aswan governorates headquarter

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood members attempted to break into Matai, Bani Mazar, Mallawi, Samallout and Abu Qerqas police stations and opened fire at them. Police forces engaged with the attackers and fired teargas to disperse them.

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood members attempted to break into Matai, Bani Mazar, Mallawi, Samallout and Abu Qerqas police stations and opened fire at them. Police forces engaged with the attackers and fired teargas to disperse them.

""The Muslim Brotherhood organization waged an armed attack"" on Bibliotheca Alexandrina. The BA security and staff confronted the assailants in the courtyard, and there was an exchange of gunfire

13 people were killed and 34 were injured in clashes between security forces and supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi. Groups attacked 12 police stations in Minya governorate, six of which they burned to the ground, and that attackers killed 13 police officers and wounded another 30 with live fire.
An Egyptian army officer and a soldier were killed when unknown assailants attacked an army vehicle in the canal city of Ismailia
Dozens of supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi blocked the road leading to Mostafa Mahmoud Square in Cairos Mohandiseen district. Demonstrators and security forces exchanged fire.

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood members attempted to break into Matai, Bani Mazar, Mallawi, Samallout and Abu Qerqas police stations and opened fire at them. Police forces engaged with the attackers and fired teargas to disperse them.
Militant groups belonging to Egypts Muslim Brotherhood (MB), set the finance ministry building ablaze
Arrests: Egypts security forces have arrested senior Muslim Brotherhood leader Mohamed el-Beltagi following the crackdown on their protest camps at Rabaa al-Adaweya and Nahda Squares-
Two churches, The Holy Bible Society and the church of al-Amir Tawadros (St Theodore) in Fayoum were torched.

Dozens of supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi stormed the Virgin Mary Monastery located in a southern village in Upper Egypts Minya and broke its main gate protesting against the security forces crackdown on the Muslim Brotherhoods protest camps in Cairo. The Mursi loyalists have also attacked six other churches and torched one of its subordinate services buildings
Pro-Mursi protesters burned the governorate building, the city council building and four police cars.

A third church was robbed and then set ablaze in Delga in the city of Deir Mawas. 30 armed Islamists were also reported to have broken into the local water treatment station and cut off the water supply to the nearby villages and towns, meaning that should a fire erupt there would be no water to put it off.
The headquarters of the Jesuits and Brothers Association was attacked by unknown assailants in a sectarian assault. The building was attacked by Molotov cocktails causing it to catch on fire.
There was a series of arson attacks against Christian-owned stores, including a pharmacy and an interior design store, in Minya.
In Bani Suef, protesters gathered outside of the Mary Girgis Church in Al-Wasta City, but were prevented from assaulting it by residents.
Security measures: The army-backed interim government imposed a month-long nationwide state of emergency and curfews in Cairo and 13 other provinces.
A Coptic man was shot dead inside his house in a village in Minya.
At a church in Assiut the Pastor of the Adventist Church and his wife were kidnapped.
At least nine people were killed in the Egyptian province of Fayoum, south of Cairo following fighting at police stations between Morsi supporters and the security forces.
29 protesters died in clashes with security forces in Helwan

column9: Baptist Christian Group (Egypt); Evangelical Christian Group (Egypt)
column17: The Baptist church in Beni-Mazar, the offices of the Evangelical foundation and those of Umm al-Nour in Beni-Mazar, Minya were attacked and burnt
18 houses of Coptic families in Dalga, Minya, including the home of Father Angaelus Melek of the Holy Virgin and Anba Abra'am's were attacked.

On 14 August 2013, MB protestors attacked the police station in Maghagha, Minya, some 190km south of Cairo, as well as the homes of the town's Christians. Large sums of money were stolen from Christian-owned shops, and houses and property set ablaze.

At least 817 people were killed during the security operation to clear out the Muslim Brotherhoods sit-ins at Cairos Rabaa al-Adaweya according to HRW. Armored personnel carriers (APCs), bulldozers, ground forces, and snipers, police and army personnel attacked the makeshift protest encampment. Security forces opened fire on unarmed protesters using live ammunition, with hundreds killed by live bullets to their heads, necks, and chests. Snipers and gunmen fired into large crowds of protesters.Security forces detained over 800 protesters in the break up of the Rab'aa square protest encampment. They beat, tortured and in some cases summarily executed protesters. Death toll stood at 817
A number of MB supporters moved into Makram Ubayd area, blocked main road, chanted slogans against Al-Sisi, government.

Two police recruits were shot dead near Wady Bridge in Arish, and another three were seriously injured. On the same day, unidentified assailants opened fire on a police station in North Sinais Arish. A 21-year-old policeman was fatally shot in the chest and arm.

Hundreds of Morsi supporters cut the road on the corniche, chanting for their deposed president. Clashes erupted between [Muslim] Brotherhood members and residents of Victoria suburb in Alexandria resulting in four deaths.
A police officer was killed in the central city of Assuit.
Protests were staged in southern Beni Sueif
Egyptian police on entered a Cairo mosque containing the bodies of several dozen killed Islamist protesters after a brief standoff during which they fired tear gas

In a separate incident, seven soldiers were shot dead and five others were injured after Jihadists fired at a security checkpoint on the outskirts of Arish. An Apache aircraft shelled a vehicle belonging to Jihadists in Sinai after the vehicle attacked a security checkpoint.
Hundreds of protesters who support Egypts Muslim Brotherhood stormed the Giza governorates main building and torched it
Unidentified militants opened fire on a roadblock at the Sheikh Zuweid city gate, injuring one security personnel
A pro-Morsi group set fire to the first floor of Al-Arish city council building
Police forces and the armed forces aborted an attempt by armed people to storm a police station in October 6 City. Several attackers were killed and injured in the attempt
Defusal: Security forces succeeded on Friday [16 August] to defuse a bomb that was thrown by unidentified men at Manshiyat Nasir railway crossing in Cairo.
A police officer was shot dead by unknown assailants
Alexandrias ambulance authority head, Amr Nasr, said that at least 21 were killed in Alexandria. He added that 101 were injured in clashes, 23 of whom were shot dead.
Clashes between security forces and the Muslim Brotherhood supporters in Tanta left four dead and 68 injured
Neighborhood watch and pro-Morsi demonstrators fired at one another for hours on a bridge that crosses over Cairos Zamalek district

Security forces along with residents foiled an attempt by armed Muslim Brotherhood elements to storm the Prison Department premises in Al-Sabtiyah Street at the Downtown Cairo district of Bulaq Abu-al-Ila on Friday [16 August].

Five Jihadists, including a Palestinian from Gaza, were arrested in the early hours of Friday while attempting to break into Arish police station. RPG shells and automatic weapons were seized from them.
Clashes intensified between residents of Shubra area and scores of militants supporting former President Mohamed Mursi. Several residents were injured in the clashes.
Clashes between Pro-Mursi demonstrators and police left 4 dead in Ismailia
Clashes between Pro-Mursi demonstrators and police left 8 dead in Damietta
A civilian was killed while trying to protect a church in Sohag, south of Cairo
Police forces foiled a bid by Muslim Brotherhood loyalists to storm a police station in the Qina town of Farshut [south Cairo]
Unidentified gunmen located on the Egyptian side of the Egypt-Gaza border opened fire on Egyptian troops along the border. The incident resulted in material damage to some civilian houses in Rafah.

Muslim Brotherhood members attacked a police station in Shibin al-Qanatir in the Egyptian governorate of Al-Qalyubiyah on Friday [16 August].The attackers threw Molotov cocktails at the police station, leaving it on fire before fleeing the scene.
Security forces intensively fired tear gas on armed Muslim Brotherhood members on the 15 May Bridge, near the building of the Egyptian Radio and Television Union (Maspero), in Downtown Cairo
Unidentified assailants tried to storm a police station in Cairos Rod al-Farag area. The security forces responding by firing at the assailants who fired back with live ammunition and rubber-bullets.
Security sources also reported a police conscript was killed when gunmen attacked a checkpoint in the capital.
Marches were also reported in Beni Sueif
Marches were also reported in the Red Sea resort town of Hurghada.
In the southern province of Minya, protesters attacked two Christian churches
Unknown gunmen fired three rocket-propelled grenades at a rest house for North Sinais governor. No-one was injured.
Supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi torched a number of shops and vehicles in the Port Said governorate.
Thousands of supporters of former President Mohamed Mursi marched in Alexandria. The demonstrators chanted slogans against the army and Lieutenant General Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.
Eight people were killed and 70 were injured in clashes between security forces and protesters who support Egypts Muslim Brotherhood near the security headquarters in the governorate of Fayoum
The toll of clashes between policemen and supporters of former President Mohamed Mursi in Arish rose to six dead and 17 injured, including one police conscript
Security forces fired teargas bombs and intensified their presence around Sidi Gaber Police Station after a group Mursi supporters attempted to storm it.
Clashes broke out on Dokkis Tahrir Street between supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi and the areas residents near Assad Ibn al-Forat Mosque
Five people were injured in clashes between Mursis opponents and supporters in Sidi Beshr area.
Egypt security forces on Friday surrounded a Cairo mosque where Islamist supporters were holed up, with each side accusing the other of opening fire, officials and Islamists said.
Unknown gunmen hurled petrol bombs at the Judges Club in Alexandrias Fleming area. Several cars were torched by the petrol bombs.
Human Rights Watch documented several instances of police killing unarmed protesters at Al Azbakeyah police station.
Between six and fourteen people were killed and around 50 were injured in clashes that flared between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and army forces in Suezs Arbaeen Square.
Two journalists were stopped by men armed with sticks, who took their cameras and subjected them to violence.
Police forces at Azbakeya Police Station clashed with a number of armed Muslim Brotherhood supporters in downtown Cairo. At least 120 protesters and two policemen were killed.

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); AFP; Agence Tunis Afrique Presse; AP
column17: Protesters staged their rallies from different 28 areas in Cairo, heading to their meeting point at Ramses Square in the cities downtown. 12 people died in central Cairo in clashes with residents and police forces although some reports claim 173 people died across Egypt on Friday.

Minya witnessed clashes as Morsi supporters allegedly attempted to storm the Minya Governorate Building and Security Directorate. The clashes left two Morsi supporters killed and five injured. On the same day, loyalists of the deposed president attempted to attack a police building housing the emergency police and the traffic department headquarters but was foiled on Friday [16 August]. One assailant reported injured.

Minor skirmishes were reported around the Port Said Governorate Building and Security Directorate. Clashes also erupted in the vicinity of Al-Arab police station in Port Said, when Morsi supporters allegedly tried to break in. Protesters, allegedly armed with automatic rifles, clashed with security forces, leaving three killed and 64 injured

In Kafr al-Sheikh, three were killed and 81 were injured when security forces, pro-army residents and Brotherhood members clashed. Police forces fired teargas at a march organized by the National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy in Kafr al-Sheikh, leaving scores injured.
Al-Qalyubiyah police have foiled an attempt by a group of supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi to break into the Shubra al-Khaymah police station.
Unidentified assailants attacked a police patrol in Kafr al-Shaykh [north of Cairo] with cold weapons and batons. 7 policeman were injured.
No security personnel were injured after armed Muslim Brotherhood men fired an RPG against them during a chase on the Suez-Ismailia highway
Supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi climbed up to the minaret of the Fattah Mosque in Ramsis on Saturday and opened fire on army and police forces. Police arrested 385 suspects.
Arrests: Egyptian authorities have arrested the brother of al-Qaida chief Ayman al-Zawahri

Masked assailants took to burning the Fire and Civil Protection building, in addition to two fire trucks, after having previously set fire to the Al-Arish Customs Directorate, and stealing the contents of the facility
Arrests: In Assiut, 163 of the MBs officials and operatives were arrested. Those arrested face charges of instigating violence and orchestrating attacks on police stations and churches.
A lieutenant and a conscript were killed and others were injured when armed Muslim Brotherhood elements attacked a police patrol on the Cairo-Ismailia desert road
Two people, a policeman and an Islamist militant, were killed in a fire exchange in Egypts governorate of Sharqiya

Assailants fired RPGs at the Al-Mahajr checkpoint located in the vicinity of the Al-Arish airport, resulting in the death of one soldier, injury of two others, and destruction of one armoured police vehicle. On the same day, assailants also attacked a military base in Al-Arish, with three soldiers sustaining injuries before being transferred to the hospital.

An improvised explosive device (IED) exploded near a building belonging to the Border Security Intelligence offices in the neighbourhood of Al-Qasima in the city of Al-Hassana, located in Central Sinai. No casualties were reported as a result of the attack.
Assailants fired RPGs at a radio and television dispatcher station in Al-Arish. The RPG landed however in a nearby remote area, and the station did not sustain any damage.
Morsi supporters marched toward the Supreme Constitutional Court in Cairo
Three marches headed to Roxy Square, Heliopolis in support of ousted President Mursi
Demonstration from a mosque in the Dokki neighbourhood
Several hundred protesters briefly marched in the Suez canal city of Ismailiya,
In the city of Suez, nine people were arrested after being caught on film attacking army vehicles, burning churches and assaulting Christian-owned stores
Gunmen atop nearby buildings fired on a police station near the museum in Minya
Supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi are going to staged rallies across Cairo and Giza after afternoon prayers
Supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi are going to staged rallies across Cairo and Giza after afternoon prayers
Supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi are going to staged rallies across Cairo and Giza after afternoon prayers
Al-Ahrams correspondent in Beheira was killed at a checkpoint in Damanhaour.

At least 24 security forces recruits were killed and three were wounded, when suspected militants stopped two civilian transport buses carrying central security conscripts. They ordered the men, still in their civilian clothes, to kneel and shot them in an execution-style attack.

Reports from Suez said three army checkpoints to the east of Ahmed Hamdy tunnel were attacked, causing eight injuries. The army spokesmans office denied these reports and said that no attacks occurred on army checkpoints in Suez
Armed militants attacked the Al-Ahly bank with intense gunfire in Al-Arish in North Sinai, leading to the death of security officer.

In Alexandria pro-Morsi supporters organised a march to Moharram Bek police station during curfew hours, with the intention of breaking in. Residents of the area clashed with the marchers, causing its dispersal and the arrest of several pro-Morsi supporters by police forces. No deaths or injuries were reported.
A civilian was killed when the Malawi Museum in Minya was looted

A number of establishments in Al-Arishs Al-Salam district, including a security building, city hall, the military hospital, the Armed Forces officers club, the court complex, the traffic department building and the 1st police precinct, came under random gunfire. Military and police forces exchanged fire with the attackers and chased them off.

One supporter of deposed President Morsi was killed and another injured after clashes between pro- and anti-Morsi protesters in Jabal al-Asfar, Qalyubiyah, where ""firearms, sticks and stones"" were used.

Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi organized rallies Monday [19 August] following afternoon prayers to demand his reinstatement and denounce the dispersal of the two sit-ins in Rabiah al-Adawiyah and Al-Nahdah squares in Cairo and Giza.
Unidentified gunmen fired an RPG at a building of the military intelligence near Al-Arish Stadium and opposite an Education Ministry building

Cairo police managed, with the help of residents, to arrest 50 rioters of the Muslim Brotherhood in Al-Fajalah district near Ramsis Square [Cairo] with arms in possession. Police seized a machine gun, pistol, shotgun shells, light arms and a laptop with schemes to break into public facilities.
Supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi are going to staged rallies across Cairo and Giza after afternoon prayers

Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi organized rallies Monday [19 August] following afternoon prayers to demand his reinstatement and denounce the dispersal of the two sit-ins in Rabiah al-Adawiyah and Al-Nahdah squares in Cairo and Giza.

Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi organized rallies Monday [19 August] following afternoon prayers to demand his reinstatement and denounce the dispersal of the two sit-ins in Rabiah al-Adawiyah and Al-Nahdah squares in Cairo and Giza.
Two were killed and others were injured when bloody clashes flared between residents of a Minya village and demonstrators marching to support deposed President Mohamed Mursi
Arrests: Security forces arrested the Muslim Brotherhoods supreme guide, Mohamed Badie, from an apartment in Nasr City
Weapons Seizure: Security forces in Al-Qalyubiyah found a car carrying two boxes of Molotov cocktails, gas and black masks and clothing in Shubra al-Khaymah city on Wednesday [21 August].
A group of gunmen attacked a checkpoint in North Sinai with RPGs while security forces have launched a few attacks on the Rafah border on tunnels that were being used to smuggle goods to Gaza
Members of the Beheira Journalists Association staged a silent protest at the Lawyers Syndicate headquarters in the city to protest the killing of journalist Tamer Abdel Raouf
An explosive charge went off Wednesday [21 August] in the North Sinai City of Rafah. No casualties were reported. Army troops are combing the area for more explosives
Two police personnel, including an officer, were wounded when their ambush in Port Said was attacked by gunmen on Wednesday [21 August].
An ""armed attack took place against a joint police-army checkpoint in Sidi Jabir in Alexandria, which led to the injury of a non-commissioned officer"".
Three policemen were killed in a drive-by shooting near the Suez Canal town of Ismailia
Gunmen attacked North Sinais television building early on Thursday and exchanged fire with security forces
Arrests: Security forces managed to arrest Muslim Brotherhood leader, Abd-al-Rahman Yusif in Suez over charges of inciting violence in the governorate.
Clashes re-erupted between Muslims and Copts over neighbourly disputes in Minya. One person was killed while three residences were burnt during the clashes that erupted earlier in the day.
Defusal: A locally-manufactured bomb was defused after found inside the faculty of engineering, Cairo University
Morsi supporters rallied peacefully in the Cairo neighbourhood of Muhandesseen
Pro-Morsi rallies took place in Alexandria
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques
Three people were wounded in Al-Dalanjat in the northern Buhayra province, when residents tried to prevent a pro-Morsi march, with both sides hurling stones at each other.
Angry mobs reportedly attacked houses of Brotherhood members in the district of Gadila

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown
Two killed, ten people were injured 15 were arrested in clashes between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and Tanta residents

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown

column9: Police Forces of Egypt (2013-2014); Vigilante Group (Egypt)
column17: In the Nile Delta city of Mansoura, Daqahliya governorate, hundreds of residents attacked one of the pro-Morsi marches and police fired tear gas. Scuffles erupted in several streets.
Clashes took place in Anshas Al-Raml village in Nile Deltas Sharqiya governorate, as supporters and opponents of Morsi threw stones at each other.
Dozens of anti-Morsi and anti-Mubarak protesters held a rally outside Cairos high court amid tight security
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged five marches from several Giza mosques. Clashes between residents and the MB reported.

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques
Morsis supporters organized several marches in Al-Zaqaziq. Reports of clashes between protesters, citizens.
Unknown gunmen opened fire Friday [23 August] at a security checkpoint near the North Sinai town of Al-Shaykh Zuwayid.
78 ""takfir""i elements killed and 203 others arrested as part of the security campaigns in Sinai
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques
Five employees of Egypts Mehwar TV channel were held hostage for several hours by Muslim Brotherhood protesters in Cairos Helwan district
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques

Marches were launched in several parts of Egypt on Friday with thousands taking to the streets protesting the removal of ousted president Mohamed Morsi and the killing of hundreds of his supporters during a security crackdown
Exchanges of fire occurred in Dalja, in Minya province when police clashed with Brotherhood supporters who tried to prevent them from entering the village.
Dozens of individuals affiliated with Revolutionary Socialist group stage sit-in outside Supreme Court building to protest decision to release former president.
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques
Supporters of deposed President Mohamed Mursi staged marches from several Cairo mosques
Security source says gunmen fired shots on security checkpoint in Al-Ismailiyah, left one soldier wounded.

Security sources report killing of four gunmen, arrest of four others in residential areas in Shaykh Zuwayid City after unknown assailants driving SUVs launched an attack at dawn on a security checkpoint in the Al-Kothr neighborhood of Sheikh Zuweid in North Sinai, prompting security forces to return fire.

Two churches, in the Al-Salaam and Al-Musaid neighborhoods in western al-Arish were attacked, along with the military prosecutors office. No casualties were reported, with security forces in each case returning fire against assailants, who then fled.
Assailants armed with machine guns attacked a local North Sinai radio station and a border security checkpoint on the Mediterranean coast in the neighbourhood of Al-Musaid in Al-Arish
A prominent leader within the former National Democratic Party (NDP), was assassinated by armed assailants

Security source says explosive device went off on Al-Arish-Rafah highway. No casualties reported. Armed Forces spokesman says Second Army soldiers arrested five members of ""takfir""i group in Shaykh Zuwayid

Assailants fired rocket propelled grenades at a security checkpoint in the Al-Karama neighbourhood in south Al-Arish. The rocket missed its target however and no casualties were reported. Assailants also fired automatic weapons at security forces located along the cities ring road in southern Al-Arish.
Arrests: Cairo Criminal Investigation officers arrest Dawud Khayrat Sulayman, aide of Al-Qaidah Leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, in Nasr City, Cairo
A police officer was killed and another was injured in Minyas Malawi district on Monday as unknown gunmen fired gunshots at a military force that was designated to secure the funeral of a solider
Around two dozen young Muslim Brotherhood members took to the streets to protest against Defence Minister Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi and the ouster of deposed president Mohamed Morsi.
The MB figure, identified as Mahir Hamad, was arrested while staging a protest, along with others, in Al-Mahallah. Later residents clashed with the protesters.
Two persons were killed and another was injured in clashes in Central Sinai on Monday [26 August].
At least two supporters of Egypts ousted President Mohamed Morsi were killed and dozens wounded late Tuesday in clashes in the southern city of Beni Suef
A heavy exchange of gunfire took place between the army and unknown gunmen in Cairos Mohandessin district. An army recruit and a citizen, were wounded in the shooting.
In Ber Lehfen in south Arish, security forces said they killed two militants and arrested nine

Five militants were also arrested after they attacked a police club in Arish. The attackers were chased by security forces, who succeeded in arresting five and injuring a sixth militant, who hid in a residential building in the area
A militant was killed south of Sheikh Zowayed city in North Sinai, after an exchange of fire between a group of militants and security forces
Arrests: Egyptian police captured Mohamed el-Beltagy, a senior Muslim Brotherhood in Giza
A protest in Maadi marched from Rayan Mosque towards the Constitutional Court on the Nile Corniche.
In Cairos Masr al-Gedida district, hundreds of Mursis allies gathered in Triumph and Hegaz squares as they chanted for Mursis return.
The Egyptian naval forces wounded two Palestinian fishermen and arrested another five after their fishing boat sailed from the Gaza Strip into Egypts territorial waters
The Islamists held smaller rallies elsewhere, some descending into clashes in Zagazig where one person was killed
In Giza, hundreds rallied in front of al-Istiqama Mosque
Clashes broke out on Friday in Tanta between security forces and allies of ousted President Mohamed Mursi and the Muslim Brotherhood after the latter hurled stones at the police.

Three people were injured when violent clashes broke out on Friday between Damanhour residents and supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and ousted President Mohamed Mursi. Residents of Beheiras Damanhour arrested 14 people whom they said belong to the Brotherhood and handed them over to the police
A group of the Muslim Brotherhood allies exchanged stones with their opponents in Giza Square on Friday afternoon.
Police forces fired teargas bombs in Cairos Mohandessin area to disperse a march for supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi and the Muslim Brotherhood. According to AFP 3 people were killed
Supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi protested again on Friday, in demonstrations across Egypt, decrying the states violent dispersal of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda sit ins
Supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi protested again on Friday, in demonstrations across Egypt, decrying the states violent dispersal of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda sit ins
Clashes erupted between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) and security forces in front of Bibliotheca Alexandrina.
Clashes between MB supports and ""revolutionary"" groups outside Al-Qaid Ibrahim Mosque, in Alexandria.
Residents of the Al-Gharbiyah city of Al-Mahallah managed Friday [30 August] to disperse a march of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood group.
Security forces fired tear gas Friday [30 August] to disperse a Muslim Brotherhood rally in front of Asyuts police station. Clashes resulted from the dispersal.
Clashes between citizens and protesters erupted in the Delta city of Mansoura leaving dozens of people injured.
Supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi protested again on Friday, in demonstrations across Egypt, decrying the states violent dispersal of the Rabaa Al-Adaweya and Al-Nahda sit ins
Several hundreds of people surrounded the Ain Shams police station to call for release of the Muslim Brotherhood members
Three people were injured in clashes in Damanhours Delengat after the cities residents clashed with a pro-Mursi march.
One person was killed and at least 20 others were injured in Port Said when clashes flared between Muslim Brotherhood allies and the cities residents
Supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi staged Friday [30 August] a number of marches in the Cairo districts of Heliopolis
Two people were killed when gunmen opened fire on a police checkpoint at Cairos Nozha area
In the capitals Nasr City district, thousands marched holding pictures of those killed in days of violent clashes with police this month during a security crackdown on the Islamists.
Elements of Muslim Brotherhood clash with people in Shubra al-Khaymah
A police officer was shot dead by unknown gunmen on Saturday in the Northern Sinais city of Arish
Unknown assailants attacked police officers on Saturday in front of a church in Port Said, leaving four police personnel injured

Fierce clashes broke out between MB supporters and opponents in Rushdy district a few meters from the command of the Northern Military Zone. Army troops fired warning shots in the air to disperse clashes.
Dozens of residents of Al-Sadat City in Al-Minufiyah blazed a Freedom and Justice Party premises after clashes erupted with supporters of deposed President Muhammad Morsi.

Thousands of people staged a rally to support the army and police as well as the announced road map. They chanted slogans supporting Defence Minister Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi, urging him to combat rioters and ""militants"".
Suspected Islamists shot dead a Coptic Christian man in Egypts Sinai peninsula
The Egyptian Popular Current staged a protest on Sunday in Cairos downtown Talaat Harb Square against military intervention in Syria

Central Security forces in Aswan thwarted an attempt of a number of supporters of ousted President Mohamed Mursi to raid the provinces security office. The security forces fired live rounds and teargas to stop the raid attempt and disperse the rallying supporters.
A bomb hurled from a bridge at a police station in the Egyptian capital on Monday wounded two civilians
6 April Movement held a small protest around Supreme Judicial court, where the trial of political activists was held.
Several hundred Egyptians protested Tuesday in the frontier town of Rafah against the militaries demolition of homes across the border from the Palestinian Gaza Strip
Eight militants were killed and 15 were wounded when Egyptian security forces launched an attack via Apache helicopters in North Sinais Sheikh al-Zuwaid
Supporters of deposed president organize ""limited"" demonstrations in various parts of Cairo, Giza. Demonstrations were in response to calls by so-called Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy
A number of unidentified gunmen opened fire Tuesday [3 September] at the National Bank of Egypt in Al-Arish. Security troops deployed outside the bank shoot back.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at the Police Officers Club in Al-Arish city, North Sinai governorate, with no reports on casualties. On the same day, an officer and a recruit were injured in an armed attack by gunmen in al-Arish [in North Sinai].
Supporters of deposed president organize ""limited"" demonstrations in various parts of Cairo, Giza. Demonstrations were in response to calls by so-called Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy
Defusal: Civil defence squad defuses bomb near a security building in Kafr al Sheikh.
Scores of supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood staged on Wednesday [4 September] a protest outside the US consulate in Alexandria against what they said ""a military coup"".
A group of unidentified gunmen opened fire at a prominent figure from the Rafah tribe of Al-Rumaylat.
Two conscripts were killed and at least eight were wounded when unknown assailants attacked an army vehicle with RPGs in Sinai
A police officer was killed and three were wounded following a fire exchange with unknown gunmen who tried to trespass a security checkpoint in Aswan

A bus transporting Central Security Forces recruits to a central security sector building came under heavy gunfire by unidentified assailants. The attack left two policemen dead and six injured. The gunmen were chased down the side streets but managed to escape.
Nile News correspondent says a conscript martyred and nine others injured in an armed attack on a police troop carrier in Al-Arish

Gunmen also opened fire on the Rescue Police headquarters and private residences of some officers in the town of Al-Arish. The assailants opened fire and fled quickly, nobody was injured as a result of the attack.

On September 5, a bomb detonated near the convoy of Interior Minister Mohamed Ibrahim in Nasr City, killing 2 people. 19 people were injured, including ten police officers and ten civilians, including one British woman, but the interior minister was unharmed in the attack. The murder attempt was claimed by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis.
Another soldier who was on patrol was also injured when gunmen ambushed a security facility in central Sinai.
At a military funeral in Al-Mahallah, mourners raised banners condemning the Muslim Brotherhood.

Supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood (MB) organized on Thursday [5 September] human chains on the agricultural highway here in concurrent with calls by the National Alliance to Support Legitimacy for more protests.
Villagers of Shibin al-Qanatir managed to force dozens of MB supporters to end their march in the village as they were inciting violence against the police and army.
Army officer ""martyred"" in Al-Ismailiyah when two ""militants"" opened fire at security checkpoint in city. Two criminals were seen fleeing scene.

Unidentified gunmen fired RPGs at a security checkpoint in Al-Arish on Thursday [5 September] but no casualties were reported. In a separate armed attack on the North Sinai security headquarters, two soldiers were injured.

Hundreds of people demonstrated in the city of Rafah to protest the demolition of the army forces of houses on the outskirts of the Palestinian strip. The army forces destroyed by explosives a number of houses on the border strip since they contain inside them openings for smuggling tunnels
Security Measures: The Egyptian army started setting up a ""buffer zone"" on the border strip with the Gaza Strip to increase Egyptian security.
Protesters rallied in the suburb of Maadi following the weekly Friday Muslim prayers.
Twenty-six Muslim Brotherhood supporters were arrested for attempting to attack security forces outside the Al-Gharbiyah city hall
An attempt by gunmen to raid Al-Minya police station foiled by police forces. A six-year girl was shot dead while the Muslim Brotherhood attempted to break into a police station in Minya
An attack using live ammunition on protesters in Salam City in Cairo was reported
Clashes erupted in Damietta between supporters and opponents of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Mursi, leaving one person killed.
A bomb exploded on the road to Arishs International Airport in North Sinai. The sources added that unidentified gunmen placed the bomb
Dozens of supporters of deposed Islamist President Mohamed Morsi rallied in Cairos Mohandessin district
Clashes erupted between supporters of the Muslim Brotherhood and their opponents outside al-Qaed Ibrahim Mosque in Alexandria. One person was killed and seven were injured.
The Anti-Coup Alliance, established to condemn the ""coup"" and call for Morsis reinstatement, stated protests were also held in Minya.
In Suez, clashes erupted after a pro-army demonstration was allegedly attacked by Muslim Brotherhood Supporters.
Clashes erupted in the city of Mansoura, in the Dakahleya governorate, after a pro-Morsi march chanting against the army was allegedly attacked by unknown assailants
The Anti-Coup Alliance, established to condemn the ""coup"" and call for Morsis reinstatement, stated protests were also held in Sharqeya. Clashes erupted in Zagazig between MB and citizens
Protests in Port Said
Several protests kicked off after Friday prayer in Al-Minufiyah. Protesters denounced Interior Ministrys policy of arresting Muslim Brotherhood leading figures.
In Kafr al-Shaykh Governorate, small-sized protests started in villages leaving 14 injured.

Three people killed and 23 injured in clashes between Muslim Brotherhood loyalists and opponents in Zeitoun
Security Measures: Three military campaigns were launched to clamp down on ""militants"" in North Sinai
A ""militant"" attack took place on an army rest house beside Al-Arishs second police station
Clashes took place in Shawshina city of Al-Fayyum when the locals opposed an insult by the MB protesters who opened fire on the residents.
As many as 20 persons have been injured during clashes that took place between residents of Matartas village of Al-Fayyum and supporters of the ousted President Muhammad Morsi

Egyptian authorities arrested six people who were involved in an attack on a security checkpoint on Ismailiya-Cairo Road on Friday. Four assailants, who are assumed to be extremists, were killed in the exchange of fire with army forces at the checkpoint.
Two ""militants"" were killed by security forces in Egypts northern province of Qalyubiya
A group that calls itself ""students against the coup"" staged a demonstration by the Rabaa al-Adaweya Mosque in Nasr City. Security forces fired teargas to disperse the demonstrators.
Security forces fire tear gas to disperse Muslim Brotherhood protests in Opera Square after clashes between security forces, Muslim Brotherhood supporters
Hundreds of Brotherhood supporters gathered outside Amr Ibn Aas Mosque in Old Cairo to rally to Tahrir Square
Morsi supporters fired birdshot and threw firebombs at police who responded with gunshots and tear gas in Cairo and Giza

Violent clashes broke out in Suez between supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohamed Mursi and supporters of the army-backed government, leaving three people wounded. A man later died [on 19th October] from injuries sustained.
Two marches were staged from Khatam al-Mursalin and Nur al-Huda mosques in Al-Umraniyah district in Giza.
Supporters of Muslim Brotherhood started a march from Al-Mahrusah Mosque in Ahmad Urabi Street in Al-Muhandisin district in Giza en route to Tahrir Square
Muslim Brotherhood supporters formed human chains on an agricultural road near the entrance to the coastal city of Alexandria
Security forces fired tear gas bombs at a group of supporters of isolated president Muhammad Morsi after they tried to storm into the Martyrs Square
Heavy clashes erupted between Muslim Brotherhood supporters and locals during a rally staged in Damanhurs [north of Cairo] main street.

Security forces dispersed Sunday [6 October] a protest staged by the Muslim Brotherhood members in Alexandria after limited clashes with citizens who celebrate the 40th anniversary of the 6 October victory.

Defusal: Explosive experts defused a hand grenade found by a citizen in 10th of Ramadan City on Sunday [6 October]. A man from 10th of Ramadan City found a suspicious object in Ibni Baytak district and notified the authorities who sent experts to defuse it.
Hundreds of Muslim Brotherhood (MB) supporters gathered Sunday [6 October] evening outside Qasr al-Qubbah Presidential Palace.
Nine people were killed when security forces and Islamist protesters clashed

column16: Aswat Masriya (Egypt); HRW; Egypt State Information Service; AP
column17: Gunfire shots were reportedly exchanged on Sunday in Cairos downtown following clashes between supporters and opponenets of the Muslim Brotherhood and security forces.

Clashes erupted between the security forces and the MB supporters during the nations celebrations of the 40th anniversary of October 6 war against Israel. The Ministry of Health announced six were killed in Beni Sweif governorate
An Egyptian policeman was killed when assailants launched an attack on a Arish police station in the Sinai Peninsula
Hundreds of Brotherhood supporters gathered outside Sphinx Square in Giza to rally towards Tahrir Square
Security forces stopped Morsi supporters from entering the Rabiah Al-Adawiyah square and dispersed protestors by firing tear gas
Clashes between Morsi supporters and residents occurred in Al-Gharbiyah governorate
Hundreds of Brotherhood supporters gathered outside Rayan Mosque in Maadi to rally to Tahrir Square
Clashes between security forces and a pro-Morsi protest in Delga, Minya on Sunday leaves one dead
Gunmen shot dead six soldiers near the Suez Canal city of Ismailiya

At least two people were killed and 48 were injured in a car bomb explosion at the South Sinai security headquarters in Tour city. According to AFP, 3 policeman were killed. The attack was later claimed by Ansar Beit al-Maqdis
Assailants firing rocket-propelled grenades on Monday also damaged a satellite communication dish in Cairo that routes international calls.

Police arrested 38 members of the Muslim Brotherhood with Molotov cocktails, fire crackers and masks with them. They were arrested as they stormed the metro station near the Faculty of Agriculture premises in Al-Qalyubiyah.The MB members also opened fire on police troops and residents and destroyed entrance and exit gates of the station.
Demolition: Security forces arrested nine militants and seized explosive materials during a wide-scale security campaign in southern Rafah city. 4 houses were destroyed in the operation.
Unidentified gunmen exchanged fire with soldiers near the Giza pyramids for nearly half an hour, with no casualties reported
Participants in a demonstration rejecting the coup organized human chains and shields to protect a church in Muharram Bik Street when their procession was passing in front of the church
Students of renowned Saidiyah Secondary School, which is close to Cairo University, organized a protest in support of the Armed Forces.

Scores of Muslim Brotherhood-affiliated students in Kafr al-Shaykh University protested on Tuesday [8 October] inside the campus of the faculty of education to demand the return of what they called ""constitutional legitimacy.""
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood students staged protests outside Alexandria universities demanding the reinstatement of Muhammad Morsi.
Clashes erupted between the pro-Morsi university students and security troops after the protesters advanced toward troops deployed outside the Faculty of Engineering.
A detained student was tortured to death after being arrested and sent to Al-Salam Camp on 6 October.
Unknown gunmen on Tuesday launched attacks on security and military installations in Egypts canal city of Ismailia, leaving one soldier dead.
Gunmen killed an Egyptian soldier and injured another in the Suez Canal city of Port Said on Tuesday in an attack after midnight
Weapons Seizure: An operation carried out on Tuesday resulted in the seizure of weapons and vehicles and the arrest of seven ""militant"" elements in North Sinai.

column16: AP; Egypt State Information Service; Daily News (Egypt)
column17: Police fired tear gas to disperse protesters who tried to enter Tahrir square and arrested some rioters.
Suspected militants planted a bomb in a military intelligence office in the town of Rafah bordering the Palestinian Gaza Strip blowing it up.
In the city of Rafah, another explosion targeting an armoured police vehicle left four policemen injured with shrapnel wounds

column16: Daily News (Egypt); Egypt State Information Service
column17: Assistant Commander of the Third Army and three recruits were injured when an explosive charge went off in a convoy of vehicles, 50 kilometers in Central Sinai.
""Armed attack on a security checkpoint outside the radio station building in Al-Arish [in North Sinai]."" No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen attacked North Sinai Radio station and intelligence building in Rafah but no causalities were reported.

At least five Egyptian soldiers were killed on Thursday when a car bomb exploded at the security checkpoint where they were stationed in North Sinais city of Arish. The blast also left three soldiers wounded, in addition to the death of the suicide bomber who executed this attack.
Security troops seized two explosive charges at a building annexed to the intelligence unit in Rafah.

Mursis allies marched from mosques in Nasr City. Troops fired shots in the air to push back a few thousand Morsi supporters after a confrontation between a protester and a soldier threatened to escalate. According to Daily News Egypt, a student was shot and killed.
In Alexandria, security troops in Sidi Bishr [in Alexandria] intervened Friday [11 October] to end clashes that erupted between residents and members of the Muslim Brotherhood
An Islamic militant was killed when he tried to place an explosive device on the Al-Shaykh Zuwayid Al-Jurah road in North Sinai on Friday [11 October]
In Egypts coastal city of Alexandria police fired tear gas to disperse Muslim Brotherhood supporters when they clashed with counterprotesters
In the southern governorate of Aswan, security arrested 5 Brotherhoods supporters after they had exchanged fire with security.
At least nine soldiers were wounded when improvised bombs targeted their vehicles in the border town of Rafah
Military helicopters fired at a house and a tunnel along the Egypt/Gaza border in response to the earlier road side bomb that injured 9 soldiers.
Police used tear gas and the military fired in the air to disperse a few rallies in the southern city of Assiut.
Mursis allies marched from mosques in Giza
Hundreds of the Brotherhoods allies organized various marches in Borg al-Arab east of Alexandria.
Mursis allies marched from mosques in Mohandessin
Hundreds of the Brotherhoods allies organized various marches in Winget, Alexandria.
In Bitash, scuffles erupted between hundreds of demonstrators and residents of Agami who refused to let the protesters pass through their areas
In Damietta, seven were injured in clashes that involved an exchange of fire. Those injured in the demonstrations called for by the Muslim Brotherhood were transferred to a hospital for treatment.
One person was killed in Sharqiya in clashes that broke out on Friday during protests which the Muslim Brotherhood called for.
Mursis allies marched from mosques in Helwan
Pro-Morsi demonstrators announced protests in Beni Suef
Hundreds of Mursis allies marched to the Qubba presidential palace as they chanting slogans against the police and the army.
Mursis allies marched from mosques in Maadi
Arrests: Army forces continued to clear 20 villages in North Sinai from armed extremists and outlaws. 76 extremists and outlaws were arrested in security operations on Saturday.
Ain Shams students held a demonstration Saturday in protest of the killing of an engineering student during Fridays protests
Four armed men were killed while they were planting an explosive device near a Egyptian army convoy on the Al-Shaykh Zuwayd road that leads to the village of Al-Jurah.
Gunmen fired a rocket propelled grenade at an armored vehicle on a road leading to Arish international airport. No injuries were reported.
Supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a protest in al-Sabah city in Suez, demanding Morsis reinstatement.
Property destruction: Unidentified men set fire to the car of a leading Tajammu party member in Suez governorate

column16: Xinhua; Ma'an News Agency; Aswat Masriya (Egypt)
column17: Unknown assailants opened fire on a vehicle belonging to the interior ministry on Sinais al-Sheikh Zuwayed neighborhood. 3 conscripts were injured.
A police officer was shot dead while trying to arrest three suspected criminals. The officer got one birdshot bullet in his head while he was trying to arrest the criminals.
Egyptian security forces fired tear gas at handball fans who targeted them with birdshot Sunday during clashes at Cairo airport that left 11 police wounded

Demolition: Egyptian forces blew up and demolished five houses that were found to have tunnels in them and that the Egyptian army bulldozed four olive groves directly on the Gaza borders and removed 800-meters of walls around houses.
Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood members staged a protest in Shibin al-Kum to call for the return of ousted President Muhammad Morsi to power.

Egyptian security forces fired teargas Monday evening to disperse a demonstration by around 500 football fans from the Ultras Ahly group in the eastern Cairo district of Heliopolis near Cairo airport. Ultras staged the demonstration to demand the release of 25 of their members, who were arrested in confrontations with airport security the night before.
Egyptian authorities arrested three people, allegedly belonging to the Muslim Brotherhood, in clashes between supporters and opponents of ousted President Mohamed Mursi in Alexandria
Anti-coup demonstrations were staged after the Id al-Adha prayer in various parts of Egypt

Members of the Muslim Brotherhood and supporters of deposed president Muhammad Morsi staged a protest in the Upper Egyptian city of Qina on Tuesday [15 October] against what they called a ""military coup."" A movement calling itself ""devils against the coup"" also staged two protests in the city of Qena in rejection of what they described as a military coup and the practices of the army and police.
Demonstrations were staged in the streets of Alexandria to call for stopping security surveillance of activists and bringing to justice those responsible for the killing of demonstrators
The Egyptian rebels alliance called for demonstrations in the Al-Tahrir Square in the wake of the closure of the square to civilians and traffic by the Egyptian Army and security forces.
Six armed men were killed on Thursday morning during their preparations to attack a checkpoint near the Arish Airport in the Sinai Peninsula.
Demolition: North Sinai security forces on Thursday 17/10/2013 destroyed 16 underground fuel tanks and five diesel tanks, along with a number of ground fuel warehouses

The National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy called for rallying in the streets on Friday to mark 100 days after what it called the coup. Rallies took place in several districts of Cairo, including near the constitutional court in the southern part of the capital amid tight security
Clashes took place between pro-Mursi protesters and residents in Al-Manakh in Port Said
Clashes broke out on Friday between Alexandrias Sidi Beshr residents and Muslim Brotherhood supporters after the residents refused to let the Brotherhoods allies march through their area.
Scores of supporters of ousted president Muhammad Morsi and the Muslim Brotherhood staged Friday a rally in Aziziyah village of Gharbiyah governorate.
Villagers raised photos of Defense Minister and Army Commander-in-Chief General Abd-al-Fattah al-Sisi, chanting pro-army slogans.

Four people were injured in clashes between residents of Sharqiya governorate and Muslim Brotherhood members who staged a march near the house of deposed president Muhammad Morsi in Zagazig on Friday [18 October].
Suspected militants killed an Egyptian police officer Friday in Al Arish
A Muslim Brotherhood protest took place in the Southern city of Minya

column6: Police Forces of Egypt (2013-2014) Prison Guards
column17: Security forces foiled an attempted jailbreak in Alexandria after detainees allegedly started a fire to force officers to open an emergency exit at a police station
In Fayoum province, south of Cairo, one person was injured during a pro-Morsi march when clashes erupted between Morsi supporters and those backing the interim military-backed government
In the Delta city of Damanhour, civilians clashed with Morsi supporters who chanted anti-military slogans, forcing them to end their rally,
Scores of the Brotherhoods supporters marched in Agami area, holding banners of the Rabaa symbol as well as pictures of political prisoners and people killed in clashes.
The National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy called for rallying in the streets on Friday to mark 100 days after what it called the coup.
The National Coalition for Supporting Legitimacy called for rallying in the streets on Friday to mark 100 days after what it called the coup.
Dozens of Defence Minister Abdel Fattah al-Sisis supporters marched to urge him to nominate himself for presidency.
In Suez, security forces intensified their presence around the Arbaeen Police Station to secure the Arbaeen Square before planned demonstrations.
Unknown gunmen shot dead a firefighter in North Sinais Arish on Friday.
Egyptian riot police fired tear gas to disperse hundreds of supporters of ousted Islamist President Mohammed Morsi
A citizen was tortured inside a police station in the Public station of Desouk in Kafr El-Sheikh
After the explosion in Ismailia, security personnel searching the area found another car bomb, which had not gone off, state media reported
A car bomb exploded near an Egyptian army intelligence building in the Suez Canal city of Ismailia, wounding at least six soldiers. Ansar Beit al-Maqdis claimed responsibility.
Hundreds of Egyptian soccer fans rallied in the capital Saturday to demand the release of fans detained in a protest.
In Bani Suwayf, the security at Al-Azhar University detained a number of girl students in the Islamic Studies Faculty.
In Zagazig, north Cairo, students at Al-Azhar University staged demonstrations and chanted: ""Down down with the shaykh of the soldiers [in reference to shaykh Al-Azhar].""
Egyptian police fired teargas at Islamist students who pelted them with rocks during an anti-army protest in Cairos Al-Azhar university on Sunday for the second day. 30 were arrested.
At least three police conscripts were wounded in an armed attack on a bus in Sinais town of Sheikh Zuweid on Sunday morning
In Assyut [in Upper Egypt], students at the Faculty of Science staged a sit-in to demand the release of their arrested fellow students.
A demonstration took place in Cairo University where scuffles broke out between supporters and opponents of ousted Islamist president Mohamed Morsi
Men on a motorbike shot dead four people late Sunday, including an eight-year-old girl, as they fired on a group outside a Coptic Christian church in Cairo. 17 others were wounded.

The ""Students against the Coup"" movement in the Suez Canal University in Ismailiyah organized today a protest in front of the Faculty of Science to demand the release of fellow high school girl students who were arrested
The Maspero Youth Union called for a protest rally outside the Cabinet building on Tuesday, accusing the government of being lenient about providing protection to Copts.
Dozens of Cairo University students who are loyalists of the Muslim Brotherhood staged a protest in campus on Tuesday [22 October].
Scores of citizens staged Tuesday [22 October] a protest outside Bibliotheca Alexandrina denouncing the attack on Al-Warraqs Church of Virgin Mary.
A bomb exploded near an army checkpoint on Tuesday morning in the Northern Sinai city of Rafah, killing an army officer and a civilian and wounding five soldiers
Violence broke out at Mansoura University between protesting students and Central Security Forces. Al Ahram reported 18 injured protesters. No security officers were injured in the protests
Property destruction: A fire partially destroyed a Cairo warehouse belonging to Qatari news network Al-Jazeera. The public prosecution is investigating it.

Hundreds of students of Al-Azhar University staged on-campus marches Wednesday [23 October] while work resumed at most faculties in light of a decision by the administration not to halt education at all.

Dozens of Muslim Brotherhood students at Alexandria University gathered inside halls of faculties Wednesday [23 October] to demand the release of political detainees. Clashes erupted between supporters and opponents of Mursi.
A group of law students who support the Muslim Brotherhood chanted against the army and police and called for reinstating the toppled president before their colleagues clashed with them.

Militants killed an Egyptian soldier in Sinai on Wednesday. The soldier was killed in the Tamada area of central Sinai, a medic and a security official said, adding he was shot in the head. Another attack on a bus carrying soldiers took place on Wednesday but did not leave any casualties.
Arrests: The Egyptian authorities arrested 75 suspected assailants in a security crackdown it launched on Wednesday in Northern Sinais city of Sheikh Zuweid
A police officer was killed on Wednesday in Western Arish, Northern Sinai after militants opened fire on him
Arrests: Security forces launched a crackdown on militant hotbeds in El-Jura
